11.title: Section 24

choices: Callous answers honestly, and starts to actually engage in the conversation.
A fake name is given, and Callous gets on his way shortly afterward.
No answer; Callous simply walks away.
111.content:
Mark Callous always seemed to be an ill fit for any situation that required him to actually talk to people, and as such he was not in so great a mood over it being his turn to pick up breakfast for the group.

With a sigh as he wordlessly handled a twenty across the counter and waited on the food and change, though, he began to roll his shoulders a bit. At least he only had to do this about once a week, and that was just whenever they were due to report in early like they were now.

"Hey, cool thing. . ."

That was ignored as most of what he heard people say when in puiblic was, but Callous took a bit more focus when he felt a shoulder rub into his arm. The sort of thing that usually got people hurt, but Callous while violent had sense enough to not be automatically so.

As such, all he did was let his eyes drift to the right and about a foot downward where a redhead was pressing up against his side. She was certainly attractive, although in a more subtle, pretty sort of way rather than outright hot; in either case, Callous's first reaction was an annoyed, "What?"

"I just thought this would get your attention. You seem like the quiet type. . ."

"And?"

"Well. . ."

Callous wasn't sure what it was, but his foul mood did lessen a bit as the bag containing Section 24's breakfast was handed to him even when the girl began to rub one hand up and down his chest. "My name is Asley Sophia Labelle. What's yours, handsome?"
111.title: Meeting Asley Sophia Labelle

choices: Ellen beats Heavy Metal in short order but finds trouble with the back-up.
Before a fight can start, the rest of Section 24 drops in.
The Impact Brigade drops their cheerleader characters to handle this themselves.
114.content:
"Step, step, step up!"

That was shouted by three women at once, two significantly louder than the third, as the door to the Green & Greene Jewellers opened; all were wearing ornate masks that appeared to be made of metal, matching in design and slightly gaudy gold color with their wardrobe that looked suspiciously similar to a cheerleading outfit.

"Two."

The one in the middle said that lightly, as the other two girls - who happened to have fairly similar builds, giving the visual something resembling symmetry - each did a pair of handsprings forward from her side. When they each hit the ground with a perfect split, they followed, "Four, six, eight!"

The middle one began to this time shout, though she remained unmoving, "He is best, there's no debate!"

"Three, five, sev --"

That came from a lanky man in a similar outfit to the others, skirt replaces with shorts and mask absent; the interruption, however, came from a blond standing near the counter that questioned, "You four mind getting to the point?"

"Show respect!"

That was the girl on the right as she rose from the floor, somewhat awkwardly given her position and slightly muscular build. She wasn't sticking with the prearranged conditions now, as she said, "Don't you dare move your tongue in the presence of --"

"Yeah, yeah. Scrawny redhead with a baton-looking thing. Evil cheerleaders, really?" Ellen crossed her arms, grinning a bit even as water dripped from her hair onto her shirt and the floor as always, "C'mon, do better than that. Especially since that guy doesn't quite look worth having his own squad. . ."

"What about me?"

A shorter man entered then, but he was a lot more impressive; a muscular build was one thing, but the fact that his arms seemed to have some sort of mechanical device over the two of them that looked more than a little dangerous did a lot more to catch the young woman's eyes. "If you won't let my friends finish my introduction, I can always just skip right to the action. Name's Heavy Metal."

"Ellen Dorian, nice to meet you. Let's make this quick."
114.title: Heavy Metal

choices: Angel quickly subdues Ellen.
Angel finds herself surprisingly overwhelmed by the Section 24 member.
Before the fight can start, Heavy Metal blindsides Ellen and the group leaves.
1143.content:
"Heh, Heavy Metal? You fight with music, or machines?" After Ellen asked, she eyed the man up and down for a second before saying, "Oh, or are you one of the million people who took that name up thinking it sounded cool without any actual reason for it?"

"You tell me." The next second, Metal began to unbutton the long, black and white leather coat he was wearing. "Give you a hint, I can certainly smack you around."

"Wait."

Both Ellen and the man present looked a bit surprised at that interjection, which came from one of the three female cheerleaders on hand. Metal was the one who asked, "Yes, what is it?"

"She looks awfully wet, don't you think?"

Ellen seemed to not pass up the chance at a snarky comment there, asking with a grin, "Afraid you'll rust?"

"Perhaps I should avoid it."

After saying that, Metal gave a look over at the girl who had spoken up; in response, she removed her mask.

Then she clapped, announcing, "I prefer to keep our affairs seperate, but it'd be easier to make them one and the same on this occasion. Girls, take off your masks."

After saying that, she gave the further order, "Angel, you're up." At that, the one of the girls that had not been physically active during the cheer routine stepped forward.

12.title: Militant Gold

choices: The kitchen is a wreck, with a message from the AME written on the walls.
Someone is waiting inside to get the jump on the two.
A man is in the kitchen, trying to wire a bomb to something.
121.content:
After tossing his domino mask aside into a random corner of the living room, Stephen Heribert gave a sigh and settled onto the couch. "Well, things have gone better."

"We won - that's what matters."

When her jacket came off and her hair was tied behind her head, Narcisco preferred to be called by her name of Eva. In this case, the overly serious blond sat down next to her roommate and said, "After a victory don't worry about how things went wrong - I'll be doing plenty of screaming at the lot of you at practice for that."

"Well, nice to have advance warning I guess. . ."

"You already knew it was coming."

As the older woman set to digging around for the remote, she went on to say, "Don't worry, you and Juliet are only going to be caught in the usual crossfire. As always it's going to be Dionysios catching hell."

With another sigh, the vigilante normally known as Captain Mercury answered, "Try not to go too overboard. In this case the only thing he did wrong was --"

"I know, I know - he didn't know that Juliet was trying to pass herself off as a shapeshifter and accidentally threw a guy in the wrong direction. Ignorance is not an excuse."

"I can't help but think sometimes it should be. . ."

"Eh."

Eva rose from her seat, sighing heavily as she said, "In either case, I'm going to go get something to drink. You want anything?"

"Beer'd be good."

"Oh, hopefully that goes the way it usually does. . ."

The vigilante exited the room, then; but a second later, she gave a shout of, "Get in here!"
121.title: Surprise at Home

choices: Narcisco notices something's amiss when Shine's disguise fades away.
Shine snaps, and outright attacks the group with her light-creatures.
Shine attempts to teleport away, letting the group give chase.
125.content:
Far away from Texas. Far away from her husband, from her parents, from the children who attacked her. They wouldn't follow her here. They couldn't. She would be safe.

Sighing contently, she turned to the mirror of the store she entered, eyebrow twitching as she put her powers to work. Various appearences and outfits flashed and faded around her body until at last she settled for the outward look of a tall, blond woman with rose-red lips, sunshine-golden-hair, and fairest of face. Twirling every so slightly, the woman waltzed out of the clothing store, ready to meet the day in her new life.

Upon exitting onto the Atlanta sidewalk, however, a body fell just in front of her. It was covered in bits of rock and stone, all barely obscuring a magnificent, gaudy mask on its face.

"I got him!" Cried out a voice. As Shine turned her head, she spotted a figure waving his arms and causing a large boulder to rise into the air behind him. Her disguise faulted briefly but she caught herself."

"Hold it! He's not moving." Another cry rang out, this one from a woman. There were four of them. Matching uniforms. Two in one direction, two in another. Beyond them was an entire crowd of onlookers and policemen. They were surrounding the store. It would be impossible to get through without teleporting, but she couldn't see over their heads and find out how far the crowd went. Was it beyond her maximum distance?

Aurora began to hyperventilate. Her eyes flew from one member of the group to another. A broad-shouldered woman was coming nearer toward her. There was no way out. They were all closing in. How could they follow her? She was so careful. She wasn't even going to do anything this time.... Why did they need to do this? Why couldn't people just leave her alone and let her be happy?

"Alright," said Narcisco, stepping nearer to the body. "Let's get this sorted out once and for all."

Once and for all? Yes... Once and for all.
125.title: Shine

13.title: Sareena Black & Misty Smid

choices: Misty decides to dismiss it and head to bed.
Misty decides to follow behind Sareena, curious to know what's going on.
Misty realizes she can detect an unfamiliar man nearby.
131.content:
"Nn. . . Rena?"

Misty had rolled over in bed lightly as she sensed her roommate entering; she sounded weary and her hair was even more of a mess than usual, which wasn't too surprising given that it was about 1 AM.

"Oh, sorry. . . "

Sareena gave a small yawn herself, although through the exhaustion she was able to muster an apologetic, "Did I wake you?"

"Nah, haven't been able to sleep. . ."

"Not much better. . ."

Sareena moved over to her own bed, then, rubbing one eye sleepily (and oddly cutely) as she did so. "Sorry I'm up so late, boss had me doing some work figuring out what some artifacts Dinah and Simon picked up do; checking them and then doing proper write-ups took forever, then I decided to make a few calls and see if anyone knew anything else about White Noise. Guess what the answer was there. . ."

In spite of how frustrated Sareena had found herself with trying to track down the masked stranger who had repeatedly crossed her, Misty got a slight giggle out of that. Afterward, though, she let out a half-minded, "Sorry ta hear. . ."

"Used to it."

Sareena exhaled heavily, then took a deep breath before repeating the original action. "You want me to try some sort of sleep-inducing spell on you or something?"

"Well. . . Do got the day off, so would be nice if --"

"Wait."

Something in Sareena's tone seemed to change in that statement, and even running with a brain that had been going for 17 hours Misty could pick up on it. The Black Princess sounded mechanical in tone, although the same as ever in voice, as she said both that word and the following, "I need to go."

"Wha?"

"I'll be right back."

Without a second's explanation, Sareena proceeded to stand up and head right back out of the bedroom.
131.title: Trouble Sleeping

choices: Sareena was nowhere to be found.
Sareena wasn't there, and the front door was wide open.
Sareena was on the couch, looking like she'd been up all night.
1311.content:
Sareena was acting odd, no doubt about it, but that wasn't all that unusual for the girl - Misty knew her well, but she did have to admit that in part due to her line of work Sareena was quirky and could get overly focused on random things.

With a yawn, the blond settled back into bed. Whatever it was, Sareena could handle it; particularly if she didn't ask Misty to come along. That usually meant she was better served staying out of things. Plus she was just plain tired.

As such, Misty decided to drop the subject from her mind, instead pulling her blanket back over her, closing her eyes, and once again trying to get to sleep.

-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-

"R-Rena?"

As Misty blinked her eyes open, it occured to her that she did not sense her best friend in the bedroom. Just to be sure, though, she gave a cursory look over at her bed.

No sight of her.

Now was a reason to worry. It was daylight, but Misty didn't know much more about the time than that as she got up from the bed and she didn't too much care with no immediate sign of her friend.

"Rena? Are ya here?"

That was called out as she poked her head out into the hall - no immediate response or sense of her, and Misty was too tired from having just gotten up to take in information on the whole building like she usually did.

First instinct was to check the bathroom, but as she walked past it Misty sensed that the room was empty. Not good. . .

As she approached the living room, however, it clicked in her mind that. . .
1311.title: Misty decides to dismiss it and head to bed.

choices: Sareena heads up to the hotel room, Misty following.
Misty attempts to get Sareena to turn back.
Sareena becomes aware of Misty as they exit the car.
1312.content:
"Rena? Where are you going?!"

The blonde's call was totally ignored as the witch moved down the hall and straight out of the apartment. Misty could hear the door shut and lock. Further, there was the noise of Sareena grabbing her keys as she left.

This was interesting, figured Misty. Curious on where this might go, she slipped out of bed, dashing as softly as she could toward the door. Peeking out breifly, she checked to see the woman was getting into an elevator. As the doors closed, the lights at the top of the doors pointed toward the ground floor.

Couldn't follow in the elevator without being seen, thus the young woman turned and dashed back inot the kitchen, slipping out the window onto the fire escape. Climbing down as fast as she could manage, the blonde hopped from the bottom, landing in the alley below. Just in time too it seemed, as when she sped to the opening of the alley, she saw Sareena exit the apartment and head to the car.

Maybe she was reading too much into this. Maybe Sareena got a magic alert or something and didn't want to worry her about it because it would be dangerous. But something seemed very off about Sareena... Her posture was very limp and slumped over, her eyes half-open. As she headed to the car, Misty followed, her staying out of sight.

Now to get into the car with Sareena without being noticed. This next part was hard, but Misty trained for it with all her years of stealth at Section 24. As the sorceress opened the driver-side door, Misty did the same with an opposite door to the backseat. She slipped inside easily and timed it just right so the two doors shut at exactly the same moment. Normally the driver will look back and see if anything is wrong, which is Misty's cue to hide behind the driver's seat and avoid detection, but Sareena took no notice of it.

That was worrisome enough, but Misty felt worse when the sorceress began driving... and stopped and a Holiday Inn two blocks away.
1312.title: Friends Don't Let Friends Drive Brainwashed

choices: Sareena has her thumb in her mouth, suckling away.
Sareena is licking the back of her hand.
Sareena is waving her hand about. . . without the usual sparks of magic.
132.content:
Sareena dodged a mundane blast of energy from one rather low-level magic user right as she fired a more powerful one of her own at one of his allies. Before the man who had tried to hit her before this could even blink, the floor under him shot up just briefly enough to knock him off his feet; the man landed with a thud to the ground, after a landing that was many things but comfortable wasn't one of them.

"Heh. Ya know. . ." From where she stood nearby, having done her part to take down the couple of non-powered folks while Sareena took down the five magic-users, Misty gave a smirk and turned her head up to the watching masked man standing on a platform above. "This is fun an' all, but gets a little boring doin' things the same way every time."

"I agree."

Erac Day had his hands in his pockets, his red hair slicked back in a ponytail behind him as he spoke, "You two sneak in here, you do something or other to get through the detection I set up, and you run me 'out of town' only for me to pop up a few weeks later like nothing happened. Why do you continue to follow orders on this from your company, when you know I'm not going to stop?"

"Just doing our jobs." Sareena gave a smirk as she watched from below, knowing the only thing that kept her from flying up there after the man was that he could teleport. Or at least, kept items on hand that gave him the ability to.

"As am I. Unfortunately, it just seems to get harder and harder being run out of my covers every time you two come smashing up my gear. . ."

Day gave a shrug, and then said, "Of course, Eighth Sin hasn't found all of them. You all haven't found most of them, even - but it's an annoyance."

Erac Day, as Sareena and Misty tended to call him given it was his first alias they heard, extended the pointer and middle fingers down toward the girls as he spoke, "So I thought I would do something about that."

Before Sareena or Misty could react, there was something that launched from the tip of the glove - it was so small that neither of the girls could tell what it was, but Misty at least could sense it.

As such, she dodged the small needle that came at her; Sareena while she noticed as Misty jumped out of the way could not react quickly enough to do anything to avoid being hit in the arm.

"Ow. . ."

Only a mild pain and the object fell right to the floor, but as Erac then removed a piece of paper from his pocket he explained, "I know we've basically turned this into a little game, and I enjoy playing with you two. As such I kind of hope that while this gets you out of my way, it doesn't slow you down too long."

The next second, the piece of paper went up in flames as Day vanished from sight.

"Well, that sounded ominous. . ."

"Yeah, uh. . . Whadda those things do?"

"No clue." Sareena gave a sigh, then turned her head to Misty and said, "Take your jacket off and wrap up the two of them in it without touching them. We can rush to the base and get Hearst to look for info."

"Gotcha!"

As Misty got to removing her coat, Sareena pondered things. As she did, though, she failed to notice something she was doing with one of her hands - and she only became aware of it when a confused Misty asked, "Uh, Rena?"
132.title: Erac Day

choices: Sareena was dressed in baby clothes, seemingly without having noticed.
Sareena had gotten distracted with something.
Misty noticed a smell in the air, and Sareena was laughing.
1321.content:
"Uh, Rena?"

Sareena looked up from the floor then, not noticing what she was presently doing. Misty had gotten up now, jacket wrapped up in a bundle in her arms as she questioned, "Why are ya sucking your thumb?"

A stray look down was all that was needed to make Sareena yank the digit from her mouth. Drool had been rolling down her chin and was all over the thumb, but as she wiped it off on the leg of her dress she bemoaned, "Well, I guess we've got idea of what that thing that hit me's supposed to do."

"Huh." Misty stared at her best friend for a second as if waiting for her to say something further. When she didn't, though, the blond asked, "What's it do?"

Sareena's response was at first a dim look like she couldn't believe Misty actually asked that. Eventually, though, she shrugged it off with a, "Heh, you're such a blond."

"Um, okay. . ."

Didn't seem like she was getting any answers there, Misty guessed. As the girls walked out the nearby emergency exit (quickest way out of the building), the spy questioned, "So, uh, should I drive?"

"Yeah, that'd be best. . ."

If only due to fear of what might happen, Sareena was dragging her feet a bit. Misty meanwhile was moving as quickly as she always did when she wasn't sneaking somewhere, so she didn't immediately notice her friend lagging behind.

"Immediately," as after a moment Misty did pick up on Sareena's placement with her sense for knowing exactly where someone was - though in truth she likely would have noticed even without it had it not kicked in then.

"Rena?"

No immediate response there, so Misty turned her head back a bit. No immediate sign of the slightly younger woman, but Misty's senses soon picked up on the fact that she hadn't rounded the corner of the building. Well, easy solution there - the blond walked back long enough to glance around the corner.

And Sareena was there, but something was very visibly wrong.
1321.title: Sareena has her thumb in her mouth, suckling away.

choices: Sareena gets her senses back a moment later.
A physical transformation soon follows.
13213.content:
"'Rena, c'mon..." Stepping closer toward her best friend, Misty took the witch's hand and began walking her back to the car, "Let's get to Eighth Sin, okay? Then we can figure out what's going on here."

"Hehehee..." To the blond's modest surprise, Sareena was all giggles at this suggestion, almost skipping with the spy back to the automobile. This naturally got Misty all the more worried.

"Uh... Sareena? Are you feeling-" As she reached for her keys, the girl paused, sniffing the air loudly. Making a grossed-out face, she let out a soft, "Eww... Do you-"

"Uh-huh!" Grinning proudly to herself, Sareena proclaimed gleefully to the spy, "I jus' went poopie!" After announcing this, she followed it with a slew of giggles before asking, "It's a big one, aint' that great?"
13213.title: Soiled Sareena

choices: Misty soon finds herself under the same effects.
False alarm - it's just a pen.
132131.content:
"Uh. . ."

Misty bit her lip in dread. Well, this was certainly much more of an eye-opener as to what happened. . . With a shudder at the idea, the blond asked, "Um, Rena? You feeling okay?"

Through continued giggles Sareena stared at her blankly for a moment, before something seemed to change back if just temporarily. With a moment's hesitation, the witch asked, "Okay. . . Wait, what happened? I think I blanked out a minute there or something. . ."

"Well, uh, Rena. . ."

Seemed the Black Princess's adult mind wasn't all gone just yet. That was a relief. . . With a sigh, Misty began to explain, "Ya kinda, um, poo-- ow!"

Misty cut off then, as she felt something pointing through the jacket she was holding meet with the side of her hand.
132131.title: Sareena gets her senses back a moment later.

choices: No harm, back to the scheduled program.
The pen turns out to be more dangerous then it seems.
1321312.content:
"What the heck..." not one to swear, Misty at once began fishing through the jacket in hand.

"What do- GAH!" Sareena at once squirmed and almost leapt into the air as she felt the state of her underwear, "Oh, God! I was bad enough last time! Day is dead when I see him!"

"Yeah, but Sareena, hang on a second.."

Removing the item from her jacket, Misty at first assumed it would be a knife or a dagger, but what she found instead was a pen with one sharpened tip. "Huh... S-Sareena?"
1321312.title: A Pen Over A Curse

choices: Misty figures she shouldfind Candice before getting the situation looked into.
Sareena runs off to go deliver that hug right away.
13213121.content:
Misty held her hand up hesitantly, the jacket moving to her side to be supported against it. As Sareena stopped her angered rant, she turned to the sound of, "R-Rena?"

"What is it, Misty?"

With tears forming in her eyes at just the thought, the blond explained, "I-I think it just got through the c-coat an', well --"

"Misty?"

With a sigh as she got to be the rational one even with a mess in her underwear, Sareena explained, "There's a mark of ink on your hand - just a pen or something, okay?"

"Oh!"

Well, now Misty felt rather silly. Before she could apologize for that, though, Sareena got back to her rant. "Now, we've got to get this fixed then get our hands on Day. He's the reason I make a stinky an' hehe, maybe 'causea dat I owe him a big hug!"
13213121.title: Of Two Minds

choices: Sareena at least seems to still be thinking like herself as a big girl.
Sadly, Sareena's mental power isn't as on-the-ball as it seems.
132131211.content:
"Eheh... Uh... Right..."

Candice might be handle for this if for no other reason then she was good with kids and it'd be useful to have Sareena smaller then she currently was. Pulling the witch into the backseat, Misty cooed, "Sareena, let's take a ride, okay? Car ride?"

"Car ride!" Replied Sareena all too eagerly. As she skipped into the backseat, she asked the grown-up, "Hey... When do I gets a diapie change? 'Cause Grandpa says it's bad to wear this too much."

"Uh... Soon, okay?" Getting into the driver's seat, Misty reassurred her friend, "We're gonna go see Candice okay? YOu like Candice, right?"

"Mm." Frowning, the witch replied, "I 'unno. She did make us fink we was... was uh..."

As her mind started to come back to her, Sareena glanced around, "Wow... It's gonna be like this all day, isn't it?"
132131211.title: Switchback Baby Brain

choices: Things are interrupted by a mysterious explosion.
Sareena's adult side begins to fade away more and more.
1321312112.content:
"I guess...." Misty scratched at her head for a second, and then explained, "Unless you're just, like, fightin' it temporarily til it takes over or somefin'."

"I don't know if that'd be better or worse." Sareena sighed, arms crossing as she said, "Well, I guess before we even get in the car should try and address the whole, God.... Diaper situation. No matter what age I think I am I can't very well spend a trip to the other side of the city sitting in my own stinkies."

"Uh.... Rena?" That struck Misty as odd if only because Sareena's expression didn't seem to change when she said it. "You still thinking norm'ly?"

"For the moment, why?"
1321312112.title: Not Quite Mature

choices: Undeterred, Misty takes Sareena to headquarters.
Realizing Erac may still be in the area, Misty stops the car.
13213121121.content:
".... No reason."

As she turned onto the street and began heading back to the Eighth Sin base, Misty gulped before asking nervously, "Uh... How bad is the diaper problem anyway? I maen, the other you doesn't seem to mind much."

"Hm." Frowning, the witch squirmed a moment, haering her underwear squash around, before replying, "Not too bad... I can hold out until we get to the base."

"Right, with Candice there, they'd definitely need diapers on ha-"

Before Misty could finish her sentence, a loud explosion was heard half a block away, making a stream of smoke and sirens rise into the air.
13213121121.title: Explosions Stop Everything

choices: When they get there, the two go talk to their boss.
Once they arrive, Sareena and Misty find Candice in short order.
132131211211.content:
"AH!"

Suddenly, Misty felt two arms shoot forward and wrap around her neck. For lack of anything better to do she hugged the taller, younger woman and asked, "Um. . . Rena? Something wrong?"

"Scawy!" Misty could barely breath with the death grip the stronger girl had on her, but she tried not to raise a fuss as her friend shouted, "No like loud noises!"

The smell wasn't exactly helping with the breathing issue either. . . With a little sigh, though, Misty answered, "Uh, that's alright. . . How 'bout I take ya to the base, huh?"
132131211211.title: Back to Base

choices: Misty is assigned to take care of Sareena until she's better.
Hearst sticks Misty with a new partner while Sareena is stuck this way.
1321312112111.content:
"Mmm.." Sniffling, Sareena nodded, "K-Kay..."

o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o-o

Looking at her two main subordinates not seated in her office, Hearst facepalmed. "Oh, God..."

"Yeah..." Looking slightly apologetic, Misty reasoned, "Eheh... W-We're not sure how her magic is- we were afraid she's switch back to a baby mind before-"

"Miss Hearst! Miss Hearst!" Giggling, Sareena bounced up and down before pulling her dress up to show her diaper, her belly button, and part of ehr bra, "Lookit, Misty just changed my messy!"
1321312112111.title: Explaining It To Hearst

choices: Sareena turns back and gives her magic use a shot.
A snap of the whip scares Sareena and causes her to run off.
13213121121111.content:
"Yes, yes." Her grip was tightening on her whip, but Cynthia restrained herself from striking be it the floor or the baby. With a sigh, she instead said, "Yes, we'll have someone look into it - we'll make it a top priority, even, if only because it relates to Day. Though he's getting to be such a nuisance being in so many places we're starting to consider ignoring him entirely."

"Well, uh, great then." Misty gripped the arms of her chair then, leaning forward and on the verge of standing up as she started, "Guess I'll just leave'er ta you and --"

"Well, with the thing that hit her we have no need for her here." With a rarely seen smirk, the boss went on to say, "And there's no way in hell I'm doing this again with you mentally fit as a fiddle, so guess who's on diaper duty."
13213121121111.title: Assigned Babysitter

choices: Cynthia agrees to see a spell.
Sareena's infant brain kicks in and she runs away giggling.
132131211211111.content:
"Oh, no..." Sighing, Misty looked at her mentally-babyfied friend and back to her boss, "But.... Please? She's going to be way too hard to keep in the apartment!"

"Hey!" Turning pink at that claim, Sareena hotly replied, "It's not THAT big a hassle!" Looking angrily at Cynthia, she demanded, "besides, I can still fight! I still know my magic."

"Sure you do," replied Cynthia flatly. Looking the girl over again, she said simply, "Pre-supposing you can go through a whole spell without forgetting how to make a complete sentence, can you even cast anything anymore?"
132131211211111.title: Challenge To Sorcery

choices: The levitation works out fine.
Sareena's baby brain kicks in during the middle of it, with disastrous results.
1321312112111111.content:
"Hey, I don't even have to wave my hands and spout things off to use simple things." Sareena crossed one arm over her chest, the other raising into the air if only to make a point. "I could turn that whip of yours into a snake if you really wanted me to."

"Don't mess with the whip, or the whip crosses you, got it?" The boss still had the object in hand as ever, rolled up in one while the other held its handle. "Why don't you try something simple, like.... I don't know, do your little levitating trick or something? I would sooner you not try something that will have any permanent effects on my office."
1321312112111111.title: Magical Try Out

choices: Misty decides to get Sareena out of here while the going's good.
Hearst, angry, slaps Sareena across the side of her face with her whip.
13213121121111112.content:
"You got it!"

Not one to back out of that challenge, Sareena got to her feet, holding her hands in preparation before her. Misty for her part was a bit less eager for this, "Uh... Sareena? Maybe this isn't such a good idea..."

"Relax, I know what I'm doing..."

Sareena took a deep braeth, summoning up the threads of magic that intwined around all living things and took hold of the desk that seperated the witch and her boss. As she flexed her magical muscle, it took on a weak glow, rising just one inch off the ground.

The next moment, it flew upwards and collided loudly with the ceiling. Then the spell gave out and it fell back down onto the floor with a loud, sickening, "CRUNCH."

Sareena blinked cutely before giggling, "Hehe... Whoopsy!"
13213121121111112.title: Baby Brain Interruption

choices: Misty asks about Candice, then tries to get going.
Without thinking, Misty takes off before any mention of Candice is made.
132131211211111121.content:
Hearst's first reaction was to let her whip fall from one hand, the object unrolling as gravity did its part; before she could swing it, though, Misty cut her off with a quick, "Wait, wait! She's justa baby, kinda!"

There was still a second's hesitation, before the whip smacked hard against Misty herself. That got Sareena giggling while the blond yelped in pain, and then their boss rolled the object back up.

"There, you can take her punishment then." With a glare still on her face, Cynthia turned to examine the damage as she explained, "It looks like it can be fixed easily enough at least.... Sareena's pay will be docked for this, however."

"R-right...."

Holding her right shoulder where she was hit, Misty turned to her friend and offered, "Okay, Rena, we better go now. Don't wanna stay around too long and, uh, make the boss all grumpy an' all, right?"
132131211211111121.title: Misty decides to get Sareena out of here while ...

choices: Hearst whips Misty again and sends them away.
Sareena, upset, decides to stay with her boss.
1321312112111111211.content:
"Hehehe... Uh-huh! Cindy's grumpy!" As her hands were taken by her best friend, the witch cooed out, "She must needa nap!"

"Hehehe...." Okay, in spite of the stinging pain in her cheek, Misty had to admit that was cute. Turning back to the woman in charge, she asked, "So uh.... Can I ask when Candice can come by?"

"Hm?"

"Y'know..." Candice patted her best friend on the shoulder, remarking, "If you can send her by, it'd be a big help to have Sareena tiny enough to handle. Babies this big are just a hassle."

"Like I needeed you to tell me that."

"Babies too big?" Sareena blinked hurt at the spy before wailing, "CINDY! MISSY T'INK'S I'M FAT!"
1321312112111111211.title: Misty asks about Candice, then tries to get going.

choices: Sareena and Misty find themselves as students in a daycare.
The two are suddenly the two lead women of Eighth Sin.
The two are suddenly teenagers in an unusual small town.
134.content:
"Ya know, Rena, Ah didn't really expect him to actually be all that good a fighter."

Presently Sareena and Misty were hidden behind a desk, fighting with the Twilight Minister inside of what seemed to be his base of operations in a small office building. The two had gotten the jump on him for once rather than the other way around, but for right now things weren't going so hot.

"I do appreciate you feeling the need to deliver yourself to me this time, princess." The middle-aged man gave a smirk from where he was waiting for any sign of one of the two girls to be free to attack. "You may as well come out and accept your fate; it will not take long for you to give me what I want. . ."

"Well, I'm not going to let you do it."

"What does it affect you?"

This was an argument that always seemed to pop up after Sareena and Misty broke free of the man's alternate realities, but in this case he apparently was fine to do it even without them having fallen to it yet. "They're people of a world you have never been to and will never pay witness to - what does it matter if I use their power to stand tall in another world?"

"Because it's not right."

"Well, you two are truly saints yourselves. . ."

A stock argument, but at the same time Sareena was always annoyed when he dragged it out. Before she could say anything, however, Misty voiced her own objection.

The only problem was she stood up to do it.

"'Sides, even if we would letcha get away with that what's to stop you from -- Ah!"

"You were never very smart. . ."

Misty began to squirm and struggle for control then, but after a moment she went still. And when she did, Sareena came dashing out from through the desk in an attempt to catch the villain by surprise.

The only problem was that he saw that coming, and she was hit too.

"Now. . ."

Wearing a sinister smirk, the Twilight Minister said, "Forgive me if I wasn't planning anything for today, but maybe I can be more spontaneous with it. . . Now what I should do with you two?"
134.title: The Twilight Minister

choices: Misty meets Sareena, who is now a baby.
Sareena is the same age as Misty.
Sareena doesn't seem to be there.
1341.content:
"Misty?"

"Unh?"

The blond gave a little yawn, as she blinked her eyes open. Where was she again?

A quick look down showed a large hand on her shoulder, and tracing it to its shoulder showed the mother of hers that did not give birth to her, the one closer to being the man of the relationship in Angie Smid, not that she was entirely butch anyway given she was wearing a skirt.

"You need to try and stay up, okay? The daycare isn't going to want you sleeping until nap time rolls around."

Misty shook her head for a second as she tried to piece all of this together. Oh yeah, that was it - first day at daycare.

She was only five years old, after all, and she wouldn't be able to start school for another couple of months. . .

"Uh, mama?" That was the term for this particular guardian, who was due to start work today herself. "It'll be fun, right?"

"Oh, I'm sure it will be," the adult answered with a grin. "Who knows, maybe you'll make yourself a friend?"
1341.title: Daycare

choices: Misty begins to wonder how the baby knew her name and tries to piece it together
Misty and Sareena begin playing together.
13411.content:
As Misty stepped into the daycare, she actaully felt a little afraid. She didn't want to be seperated from either of her mommies for such a long time. But on the plus side, maybe she could make a few friends. Her spirits lifted even higher when she entered the room and found a ton of neat toys everywhere, which she wasted no time in playing with.

About ten minutes after she was dropped off however, there was a fuss over something at the entrance to her room. Some big kid was arguing with one of the ladies working there. Naturally curious, and able to tell they couldn't see her, Misty inched over to the group to listen.

"Well, I'm sorry," said one of the ladies quietly. "Our room for babies is just too full. We had to call in some extra help to handle them all."

"I just don't want my baby sister getting picked on while we're still in town. We're putting her in here so she'll be safe."

Misty peeked out from behind a tower of building blocks to the people arguing. Right next to the big kid, holding his hand since her balance was a tad shakey was a tiny black-haired baby. Part of Misty wanted to just forget about this and turn away, but something about the toddler just seemed familiar.

"Well, we'll take special care to make sure she's okay." Bending low to address the toddler, the daycare lady cooed to her, "Besides, you're a big girl, huh? I betcha you'll be okay here!"

After a burst of giggles, the baby let out a loud, "Uh-huh!" before her brother bent down to hug her. As the big kid left and the baby was left alone to be surrounded by older kids , Misty skipped over to her, mainly out of a sense of curiousity.

"Hi..." The four-year-old cooed out slowly. "Um.... How are-"

"MISTY!" To the little girl's surprise, the baby let out a loud squeal of joy before leaning forward to hug the child around the waist, snuggling her affectionately.
13411.title: Misty meets Sareena, who is now a baby.

choices: Sareena decides to demonstrate her magic for Misty's benefit.
Sareena discovers her magic doesn't work, then starts to cry.
134111.content:
". . . Um . . ."

While the hug was nice and Misty was happy to return it, it raised a lot of questions in regards to this unfamiliar baby. She only hesitated an awkward secord or two before asking, "Um, how do you know my name?"

"Wha?"

The black-haired baby wearing two large hairbows gave a look up at the little girl, confused. Before she could say anything, though, there was an interruption from one of the adults on hand. "Heh, looks like you two became fast friends, huh?"

"Oh, um. . . Hehe, I guess."

"That's good!"

The woman gave a smile as she patted Misty on the back, then said, "Now, you two go play, okay? There's not a lot to do out here in the lobby, and you've only got two or three hours til naptime."

"Naptime?"

Something about that sounded unusual to Misty, but she didn't question it. Instead, she let go of the hold she had on Sareena, then lightly cupped her hand and helped to walk here into the next room.

As the pair headed into the next room, their world was filled with the sight of toys and other children in front of them. Now beginning to feel a sense of worry for the baby, Misty gave her hand a squeeze before telling her, "Hey... Don't feel scared aobut the big kids, okay? I'll make sure they won't pick onya."

"Hm?" Sareena had to remove her thumb from her mouth to ask properly, "Whatchoo mean scahed?"

"You know..." Bending down slightly, Misty explained, "Of the big kids. You scared they'll pick onya?"

"Uh-uh," replied the baby with a shake of the head. "'Dey twys an' I gots magicsh!"
134111.title: Misty begins to wonder how the baby knew her name

choices: Misty intentionally falls down and tells Sareena she did it.
As Misty tries to calm the baby down, she realizes her powers don't work either.
1341112.content:
Okay, this was kinda cute. Smiling, Misty bent down to smile at the baby, "Awww... Well, that'd be neat. Can you show me your magic?"

"Uh-huh!"

Giggling, Sareena bounced a little bit before waving her hands in a rather spastic fashion. As she did this, she accompanied the motion with a kind of babbling that Misty supposed was meant to be a spell. Truthfully though, it sounded more like baby-talk. But Misty supposed that might've just been due to Sareena being a baby...

It was apparent it was obviously not meant to be baby talk at all, since when Sareena stopped cooing, she thrust her arms out clumsily at Misty's direction. This had no effect, whatever the intended effect was meant tobe, and the blond just blinked at her in confusion.

"Whuh..." Sareena's eyes began to well up with tears. As the baby saw the lack of impact to her little spell, she turned sadly to the palms of her hands, "I-I-I dun unnerstand... Why dun it work?"
1341112.title: Infants Are Bad At Magic

choices: Sareena and Misty suddenly remember who they are and where they're from.
Sareena discovers she still has her magic.
Sareena, Misty, and the new girls head out to find some adventure.
1343.content:
"Ugh..." Raising her head, Misty shook her head in confusion. As she sat up from the concrete and looked around in a daze, she asked, hazily, "Sareena?"

"Hm?" As she sat up herself, and shakingly rose to her feet, the black-haired witch asked, "Misty? What... What just happened?"

"I dunno..."

Something felt extremely off about the current situation to Misty. For one thing, her clothes didn't seem right. They were tighter and trendier then she felt used to. For another, Sareena's hair appeared much shorter then it typically was. But most of all, where were they? It seemed she should know, but she didn't.

Sareena brought up another valid point she hadn't thought about, "Um... Weren't we just talking to some guy-"

"Yo! Sareena!"

The girl with the bow turned her head to spot a short girl with dyed hair rushing toward her, hugging her about the waist. As Sareena's brain began to catch up with her, she asked, "Hi?"

"Heheh. How's it goin, Princess?" Breaking off the hug, the shorter girl waved behind her to a pair of identically-faced redheads following behind her, "How're you feeling? We got mixed up with that toy-store-spirit and you guys just disappeared."

"Um..." Sounding weirded out, Misty asked, "Toy store spirit?"


"Uh-huh," replied one of the redheads with a nod. "We uh... were stuck as little girls for a little while, and you two were talking on and on about being part of Hour-Twenty-four or something."

"Yeah," noted the other twin. "What was that about, anyway?"
1343.title: Oppur Town Days

choices: At the carnival, Sareena and Misty find their way to the hall of mirrors.
The two quickly begin enjoying themselves with their new batch of friends.
13433.content:
Shrugging off the two member's sudden disappearence, the quintet of girls began to head down the street, speaking about their latest encounter with the unknown.

"W-Well, I didn't think it was as um... As bad as some of the other stuff," noted Suzanne with a smile. "I mean... I never fe-felt like it wanted to hurt us or anything."

Katlyn smirked, replying, "I dunno. Seeing your old Miss Millie doll come to life freaked me out a little." Stretching her arms over her head, she added, "I guess it wasn't as scary as us being turned into boys or babies at the very least."

"That wasn't scary, that was adorable!" Putting an arm around the ponytailed redhead, Wendy giggled out, "You know you're probably the cutest baby in the world, don'tcha Katie-Cat?"

All of this sounded very foreign to Sareena and Misty, as if they were remembering a hazy dream they had a week ago. At the mention of being turned into babies however, the blonde snickered.

"Heheh..." Grinning, she teased out, "I dunno, 'Rena was pretty adorable too."

"Oh, c'mon!" Turning pink, the youngest member of the group pouted as she pleaded with the twins, "Can we head out then? I thought we were going to meet up with... Mm..."

The name of the other girl escaped Sareena for a moment, at the same time that a wave of dizziness hit her. As her head swam and her knees shook, Suzanne finished for her with a helpful, "Melly?"

"Right. Her." Dizzy spell fading, Sareena asked again, "Can we head out to-"

"Ooo..."

The four other girls stopped walking noticing Wendy was several feet behind him, staring out down the street. Before one of the others could inquire why, she pointed and announced, "Hey, guys! The Carnival's in town! Whudda say after we get Mel we make a little stop?"

"Uh... Wendy?" Trying to be nice in breaking this, Suzanne mumbled out, "Don'tcha think the carnival might be a little... y'know, dangerous?"

"If we say that about everything, we'll never go anywhere!"
13433.title: Just another Oppur Town Day

choices: The two decide to go out and ask for info around the vigilante community.
Misty remembers where she saw the man's face before.
The search doesn't take long - Sareena and Misty run into them in short order.
135.content:
"And that is the sort of thing that I would rather not have to try and cover up, as it borders on impossible to make people believe these folks are one in a million afterward."

With a sigh as she pressed the off button on the TV and the image on it went to black, Cynthia Hearst set to explaining, "I'm sure the two of you can gather what needs to be done about this."

"Uh, yeah. . ."

Misty was the first to speak, as she pointed at the TV and said, "Ya know, it was kinda hard to see him for that armor an' the camera angles and all, but that guy looked kinda familiar."

Both of the more serious women in the room looked a bit curious about that, but it was Sareena who inquired, "Do you know him?"

"Don't think so, just recall the face and hair. Mighta seen him on TV or somethin'."

"Hm. I hope not."

"Now, if you don't mind me asking a question of my own. . ."

Sareena stopped to wring her hands together for a moment and then questioned, "What exactly is the difference between these two anyway? By the looks of that video they had the same powers."

"From what I have heard of other sightings, the one in fur and jeans seems to be able to do what other people can by touching them with his left hand, but he doesn't seem to retain one ability after getting another. If he touches with his right. . . Something happens, but we're not really sure what."

"Helpful. . ."

Sareena rose from her seat then, and turned her head to her best friend as she said, "Come on, Misty, might as well go see what we can find out."
135.title: The Assignment

choices: A stop at Wikipedia later, the girls have themselves a name.
Before they can properly investigate that, their boss calls back for them.
Sareena decides it's unlikely an actor's involved and chooses to look elsewhere.
1352.content:
As the two girls walked through the base, Sareena made a point of listing her thoughts aloud to her best friend, "Okay, first we should probably go ask Rayne. He's not exactly a friend, but he has a lot of connections in the whole superhero business and one of them might know these guys."

"Wait, Rena, I think I 'member where I saw his face. . ."

"You do? Good, because we could be hunting for weeks with that route if we don't get any leads. Of course, even this isn't concrete. . . Where did you see it?"

"Uh, well. . ."

Misty thought back on it for a second, then said, "There was this. . . It wasn't a movie, like a mini-series? I forget the name and the channel, but he was in it."

"Uh, Misty?"

Sareena liked to keep gentle with her friend, for obvious reasons, so she hesitated a second before saying, "Unless it was about something memorable, that's not really very helpful."

"Oh, yeah, it wasn't like anythang I had seen 'fore."

As the two girls kept walking, Misty explained, "Ya know those kids with the weird blood and superpowers? Was a movie 'bout them, showing what would happen if they went evil or somethin'. Was really bad, acted like a sign of what was to come or somethin' - super serious."

"Good, that should help a bit at least. . . Was he in a major role?"

"Yeah! Yeah, uh. . . He played that Alex fella, actually. Movie had a bunch of real people being played in it, he was one of the main ones."
1352.title: Recognition

choices: Vincent Garland
Hugh
Brick Leston
Leonard Spencer
The Magnificent Mashenka
14.title: Starchild

choices: Alex happens to be listening in from close by, and comes running in.
Alex waits to hear details and try to beat them to their destination.
Alex goes to ask Sareena for a bit more information before acting.
142.content:
"Mr. Marcano's office - Roxanne Matthews speaking."

Roxanne, as she was called when handling the phones, was a black-haired girl, average height but on the pale side; she stood in sharp contrast to the only other person in the small office rented out at the former location of a video store, a lanky Latina girl named Jane Rodriguez who was presently reading a magazine out of boredom.

"Wait, really?" Zan had her voice an octave higher, so rare an occurence that Jane turned up to see what exactly was going on when she heard it.

Not that there was any direction indication, though, other than a quick, "Yes, tell your men that Mr. Marcano is in your debt, Mr. Kodzo - we'll see you."

At that, the woman hung up and turned to her only coworker - not only on hand, but at all - with a quick, "Go tell Marcell that Kodzo has delivered big news."

"You got it. Though, uh. . ."

A little awkward to ask, especially seeing as how the only reason Jane didn't know was she asked Zan to take her shift at the front desk due to a headache, but the girl asked, "What is it, though? In case he asks?"

"You just want to know, don't you?"

"Well. . ."

"Hm." Though she tended to restrain herself, Zan did allow a smirk, as she slumped forward on the desk until she was supported on one elbow.

"Well,as part of a little trade with the Sin bunch Kodzo picked up a tip on unusual dimensional effects out in Texas or something."

The free arm of the girl at the desk was waved about a bit, as she continued, "He knew we've been looking for things of particular power, so after doing a little research he threw it our way in return for Marcell's help with that Cheerlegion business."

"Cheerlegion? Was that the whole thing with --"

"Pretty self-explanatory, yes."

As Jane stood up Zan straightened her back, elbow coming off of the desk and chair rolling forward a bit as she continued, "Kodzo had his men ask some people in Sin to do a little looking into the details; apparently like some sort of reality-warping power out there, just the kind of thing a group like ours could get a lot of use out of."

"Neat. . ." Before running to tell their boss, though, Jane questioned, "Hey, uh. . . Why isn't Kodzo wanting to keep that to himself, anyway?"

"He said there's too much risk, and no real benefits from failure. Plus if news about this spreads too far could be too many people trying to claim it for themselves - so keep it under your hat if you can."

Unfortunately for the girls and their boss, though, that checking in with Eighth Sin presently amounted to a blond-haired, twenty-five-year-old male teenage girl listening in via a bug in the office.
142.title: The Prince and the Alpha Male

choices: Sareena has Alex come inside and tells him what she knows.
Sareena doesn't know anything, so Alex asks her to teleport him there.
While Alex seeks information, so does the Alpha Male elsewhere.
1423.content:
When there came a knock at the door, before either of the girls sitting on the couch stood up Sareena turned her head and asked her friend, "Who is it?"

"Um. . ." While Misty could instantly recognize people she was around often enough, this was one that she'd only been near a handful of times. After a moment, though, she answered, "Think it's that Alex fella."

"Hm."

With a frown, Sarena rose from her seat and walked over to the door. She could have teleported or opened the door from a distance, but she often found that not worth the trouble; as such, she soon twisted the doorknob and gave a greeting of, "Hello, what do you want?"

"Well, that's certainly direct."

"We're not friends - not going to be outright rude to you, but I'm not going to act like we are."

"Fair enough." With a little sigh then, the vigilante explained, "Long story short - I got bored and asked some friends of mine if they had anything they needed done with some of their usual foes."

"Usual?"

"In this business, you tend to wind up with a handful of people you regularly take because you know them best and everyone likes to keep track of what their previous busts are doing." With a dismissive wave of his hand, Alex questioned, "Know of some guy who calls himself the Alpha Male, runs out of a small building next to a laundromat with a couple of girls?"

"Doesn't exactly sound like the sort of thing Eighth Sin would care about, no."

Alex shook his head, with the explanation, "Yeah, he's not a big deal on his own. Him and his girls, though, have acquired knowledge of some reality-warping thing out in Texas, though, and wondered if you could tell me more about that. Details are sketchy but apparently some kind of odd residue from teleportation or something - I don't understand it, but says it's mostly centered around one town and he wants to find a way to harness it. So can you tell me anything?"
1423.title: Seeking Information

choices: Brick explains a client is withholding funds.
The assassin has someone after him, and wants some extra protection.
Alex refuses to even hear what it is, and Brick promises retribution.
143.content:
"Hi there."

The second after having opened the door blindly, Alex found himself beginning to twist the hand that wasn't still clutching the doorknob into a fist. As he did, he questioned, "This is awfully direct, isn't it?"

"Heh. Ya know, if I was going to kill you in your own home," said the redhead at the door, street racer by hobby and assassin by trade Brick Leston, with a mocking grin, "I wouldn't bother knocking. I'd probably get some cheap old car, run it through the room below yours, and let the building collapse before you knew what hit you."

"I'll be sure to keep an eye out for that in the future, you psychopath. . ."

After saying that to the redhead, the vigilante got to the subject at hand, "What do you want?"

"You help people, right?"

"Not usually on a volunteer basis, particularly not with your kind of work and not your kind of people."

"That's a shame."

Brick rolled his eyes which prompted Alex to do the same for entirely different reasons, and then he explained, "Fact is, I need help and I could pay well."
143.title: Brick Leston

choices: The next day, Alex turns his attention to other matters.
About a week later, Brick shows back up.
After a moment's thought, Alex decides to reconsider.
1433.content:
Brick gave a smirk, leaning in closer to the teenage girl in front of him as she explained, "See, there's plenty of money in it for you if you --"

"Say no more."

Alex held up a hand, stopping the man mid-sentence and explaining, "I will not help you. I don't work for cash alone, and I don't help out people who neither need nor deserve the time of day. Particularly those who come knocking just to try and bribe me."

"You're quite a bitch, aren't you?"

Brick backed up a bit, crossing his arms as he questioned, "Fine, you think that just because of my occupation I'm not worth your time? And that my money's not good enough for you?"

"That's exactly what I think, yes."

"You think I'm not worth your time, yet you help the filth that makes up most of this city? You help them?"

"Yes, indeed."

"Hmph."

The redhead bent down to the ground, picking up his helmet he seemed to carry with him everywhere he went. He did not immediately put it on, however, instead holding it in hand as he explained, "Fine, I'll leave. But be prepared - when I finish with this, I'm coming for you."

"Heh. You and plenty of other people, buddy."

The next second, Alex slammed the door shut behind the redhead.
1433.title: Alex refuses to even hear what it is, and Brick...

choices: During the proceedings, someone tries to steal a competing company's next model.
A wrong turn leads Alex and John to witnessing some less-than-legal plotting.
Alex foils an assassination attempt on Spencer... that's not quite legitimate.
144.content:
"Seriously, why did you drag me out to a car show?"

John gave a sigh, knowing full well he had already told Alex this a couiple of times. Still, as the two stood in line outside the building in which the event was to take place, he reiterated, "Beth said the keynote speaker at this thing has been kind of followed by problems lately, she figured if I was going it'd be good to have somebody here to help."

"I know that. Why did you drag me out here? I'm not any more into cars than any of your usual crew; hell, I imagine that Ellen chick probably likes them more than I do."

"A bit, but she was busy."

After answering that, Jonh felt the need to say, "Hey, relax. If nothing else you can marvel at the latest innovations in things that were at their best fourty years ago."

"Some mechanic."

"Hey, I can fix new cars, doesn't mean I like them as much."

"I suppose this is supposed to be where I say 'fair point' or something? Because it's not really one."

The two went quiet for a second in the noise of the crowd as they reached the front gate, handing their tickets off at the entrance and then walking inside.

"Well, this looks exactly like I figured it would."

Alex crossed his arms, grinning for a second as he said, "A bunch of shiny car parts, surrounded by people staring at them in bizarre awe."

"Not any good if they haven't gotten dirty, I think." John of course knew Alex was indicating something else entirely, but all the same that point was one he could get behind. "I'm mostly just here to take a listen to what Spencer's got to say - he's kind of an interesting man."

"Yeah, yeah."

While the two got to walking, Alex felt the need to say, "Unless his presence brings interesting happenings, I'm going to disagree."
144.title: Car Show

choices: Shinobu enters, and assumes Alex is the attacker she's set up to stop.
Spencer assumes that Alex is really Shinobu in a wig.
Spencer asks Starchild to meet him in private. To thank her, of course.
1443.content:
As the two friends mingled bored through the exposition, walking through the fleet of shiny undriven cars on their rotating platforms, they attempted to make mild chit-chat with the other goers to the show. Finally the lights quietly dimmed and a hush came over the crowd.

"Great," noted Alex with a sigh. "You mind telling me what the big deal is about this guy? Didn't his dad also make good cars without all the media circus?"

From behind the stage, Leonard Spencer made his entrance, waving lovingly to the cheering crowd, a bright spotlight focused solely on him. As the attending press and car buffs began to clap, the two former boyfriends did the same, albeit out of politeness.

John shrugged, weakly clapping with the rest of the crowd, "His dad got a lot of press in Britain, but since junior took over he pushed for more media attention. And I think they went with it because he's prettier and cameras love him."

"I don't really get why people think he's so damn good-looking," noted Alex, watching the figure take a microphone on the stage. "I mean, yeah, he's pretty, but not breathtaking. Certainly not enough to make me go nuts over him."

"I think he looks good, but I don't get all the hype," remarked John. A reporter nearby shushed him but he ignored it. "Maybe if he got a porno shoot, that'd be something." Turning to the vigilante, he added, "They say he's a really nice guy in real life so-"

"FREEZE!"

Both figures turned, along with every other member of the crowd to a side door near the stage. Standing there was a figure in looming black body armor and a ski-mask/army-helmet (both black) combo to cover his face. In one hand was a bullhorn, the other an enormous, black assault rifle.

"Everybody on the ground!" He demanded through the bullhorn, cementing his point by firing momentarily into the air with his rifle. At once, the expo-goers did so, although with the gun, the demand was quite unnecessary. Throwing the bullhorn to the ground, the figure instead unshouldered a saddlebag and held it out. Speaking in an absurdly thick Southern accent, he demanded, "Everything valuable on your person, whip it out! Wallets, jewelry, keys, fucking everything! I want it in-"

"W-Wait! Stop!" As the strange, intimidating madman made his demans, Spencer stepped forward, clearly afraid. "Listen... I keep five thousand pounds on me at all times! I'll hand it out if you just promise to leave these people alone!"

"What the fuck is Brit money gonna do for me?!" Grabbing the tycoon by his tie and pulling him closer, the figure pointed the gun into his cheek, "I fucking hate foreingers like you! Stay out of our damn country, you ugly fucking Englisher!"

Inwardly, Spencer was trying not to grin. The hitman he'd hired was going overboard on the American accent, but other than that, it was perfect. He assured people he wouldn't need security just so he could make this happen. Granted, there was a worry about half the crowd having firearms, this being America, but he avoided most of the danger when he didn't have it happen in Texas. Thankfully, the gun here was full of blanks.

Shinobu should be coming in momentarily, "I-I'm sorry...." Not whimpering but frightened, hitting that perfect mixture of heroic bravery and humanizing fear, the billionaire demanded, "But you can't hurt these people..."

"Oh, yeah?" Glaring the mystery man shouted, "Maybe I'll be happy jus' killin' y-"

"Excuse me."

The black-clad hitman turned in surprise, seeing Starchild standing just behind him. Before he could move, the vigilante easily twisted his arm so that he dropped his gun, and in a smooth, flowing motion grabbed it as it fell and smashed it against the stranger's jaw. He was knocked backward and fell to the ground unconscious.

"There we go." Removing the ammo cartridge from the weapon and throwing it into the corner, Alex offered the fallen tycoon a hand. "You alright?"
1443.title: A Foiled Farce

choices: Shinobu comes in late, having missed her cue
Spencer attempts to get show his appreciation by getting a kiss from the hero.
14432.content:
Before he accepted the vigilante's hand and got to his feet, Leonard looked Alex over from head to toe curiously. There was a certain probing, searching feature to his gaze, particularly over the hair that actually belonged to Dorothy.

"Heh." When he got no response, Alex let out a low, sarcastic, "You're w-"

Before the word could even be finished, Spencer's hand slapped into her own and the billionaire scrampled to his feet in a single smooth motion. Before Alex could step between him, Leonard pulled his arm around the viginalte and pulled him to the podium.

Speaking under his breath, Spencer asked, "Hair wasn't what I expected."

"Well, I just wahsed it," quipped Alex, irked. "Next time I rescue you I'll-"

"No, no, it's fine." Looking over his shoulder at the crowd, he hushed out, "Very good. I can barely tell it's you."

Wait, what? Did this person know Dorothy? Was he somehow affiliated with Section 24? He was good-looking and wearing an expensive suit; maybe he was a friend of Power's. Or maybe this was a mere mistake of identity. Speaking quietly, Alex asked, "What exactly do you-"

"Just wish you'd consulted me before you did the anime route. Might be trouble with the rights." Turning into the microphone, Leonard announced loudly, "Our hero, Ladies and Gentlemen!"

The crowd went wild. Alex looked to his side and spotted a pair of large men in black dragging off the madman with the gun....

"So tell us, my dear," asked Spencer with a happy smile, "What brings you to our expo?"
14432.title: Starchild/Shinobu Switchup

choices: Alex takes a look at the first mask and finds it a demonic red face.
The second mask is a rosy-cheeked one that looks like a little girl.
The third looks like some sort of cat-faced woman.
145.content:
"Mwah!"

Even with their relationship being one with the two properly dating, Alex always liked to kiss Laura on the cheek just because she always got slightly red and he liked the warmth of it.

After that happened, Laura asked, "So, uh, call me tonight?"

"I'll do that. Doubt I'll be doing anything this evening, but if something comes up I'll give you a hollar."

"B-Be safe!"

Laura exited the front door then, and Alex moved to the couch and eased onto it with a contended sigh. This was the sort of life he enjoyed, breasts aside, and even they were pretty familiar after so long with them. . .

He set to looking for the remote, then, but before he found it he spotted a package in the corner of the room. That was peculiar, but Alex decided that rather than turn on the TV he should investigate that. And once he took it in hand, he quickly saw that it was addressed to Dorothy Wright.

"Odd." Did Alex order anything off the Internet? He didn't recall doing so in the past day or two; but then, maybe Dorothy herself did, she did that sometimes to make sure things went through easier. "But let's see. . ."

The return address was within the city, although Alex didn't offhand recognize the street name; not that surprising, but it did raise a few more questions. As he opened the box, the first thing he saw was a piece of paper lying freely atop three objects concealed in bubble wrap.

Then he pulled the piece of paper out, and got to reading.

Forgive me for the delay and sudden nature of things, but I was among those present when you fought that Tryton man in February. I recently came into possession of some valuable masks that I have no need for or place to put and I thought that you might like to have them. Thank you for your help, and may you continue doing what you do best.

"Weird, but okay."

Seemed reasonable enough, Alex got a lot of things of this nature from that incident and his records were easy enough to pull if somebody knew and cared who Starchild was. So which mask to take a look at first then. . .
145.title: Appreciation

choices: Alex takes the mask off and puts them away, but later begins to act peculiarly.
The mask seems to vanish, as if it's been absorbed by his face.
Alex finds himself oddly compelled to continue to wear the mask.
1452.content:
"Well, this is certainly colorful. . ."

That was about the extent of what positive Alex could say as he pulled out the first of the three masks. It looked bizarre, like some cartoony attempt at capturing the essence of a little girl.

For one thing, it seemed to be some sort of porcelein, and despite being very smooth and looking like it would fit Dorothy's face perfectly there were no holes for the eyes, mouth, or nose, nor anything to keep the mask on.

"Is this decorative or something?"

That seemed like the safest bet - maybe the three masks were supposed to be kept in a case or propped up on a shelf or something.

"What an odd gift. . . Guess will need to send the person a thanks or something, though."

Alex gave a bit of a sigh, figuring if nothing else he could appreicate the generousity. It did seem like that whole Valentine's Day run-in with Tryton had brought nothing but bad with all of the increased publicity for Starchild, but not a lot of downsides to having a few creepy masks so long as they could be locked away somewhere.

"Heh, actually, guess might as well see if you just can't see the eyes or something on this thing. . ."

No way the mask would stay on on its own anyway, of course, but all the same the vigilante was curious enough that he lifted it to Dorothy's face and put it over; it was a surprisingly perfect fit.
1452.title: The second mask is a rosy-cheeked one that look...

choices: Alex begins lickign on the back of his hands and scratching things.
Alex is sent downtown to stop a madman.
Alex leaves the house to find he can talk to cats.
1453.content:
"Huh.... Good craftsmenship on these," remarked the vigilante as he turned it over in his hand. Carved from wood, never see that too much. Maybe Laura could use it for a play or something. Every time he'd heard about the plot of Cats, Alex thought it sounded beyond stupid, but he'd sit through it to see Ropun perform.

Figuring he might as well try it on first before he showed it to his girlfriend, Alex moved to a mirror and slipped the piece of wood on over Dorothy's face. It felt light, almost like it wasn't even there... The vigilante blinked at himself in the mirror when his phone went off. Suppressing a sigh as he removed it, he couldn't help but let it escape when he saw the caller was Sarabeth.

"What is it? I just got in."

"Don't get comortable," came the voice on the other end, "I need you to go out."

"Uh-huh..." Pacing about the room and feeling a bit of humor from talking about serious vigilante business while wearing a cat mask, Alex asked, "Should I just walk over to the apartment?"

"I'm not there- I'm at headquarters," replied Sarabeth at once. "And don't head there either. There's a problem downtown."
1453.title: Cat Mask

choices: Alex discovers the mask has gone missing before he leaves.
The mask is still in place, and Alex decides to take it off before going.
14532.content:
"Oh, of course there is." With a sigh, Alex changed the subject to question, "What is it this time? Hopefully it's not something that could be done by somebody else in the know but you'd rather have me because I'm awesome or something."

"Partially, but there's more reasoning beyond just, 'Hey, Alex Rayne is pretty cool, isn't he?'"

"Good to know."

The cat mask was still on, and Alex didn't bother to remove it just yet as he questioned, "What is it this time? Atlanta throwing cars, or that Kodzo guy calling me out? Never really met him but he seems to have this thing for blond chicks."

"I've heard. Anyway, it's this guy in white and red armor who seems to be able to teleport and blow things up easily. Something or other's made him want to take his anger out on us - hard telling what, this company's kind of made a lot of people mad - and he seems like the sort of person you tend to beat with ease."

"So stop a guy flinging bolts of death and literally moving at the speed of light while I simply claim to?" Alex went quiet for a moment, before answering, "Yeah, I can do that."
14532.title: Going Downtown

choices: Alex shrugs it off at once and leaps into action.
Now weirded out, Alex stops to talk to Sarabeth about the subject.
145321.content:
"I knew I could count on you."

"Yeah, yeah." Waving a hand dismissively, Alex replied into the phone, "Just tell me why any of your other boys can't handle this?"

"Most of my go-to people are on missions. Of the ones that are here, John went to Miami for the weekend with his sister, Misty and Sareena are incapacitated, and Albert would just say he's busy."

"Ah." Not terribly interested even though he'd asked, Alex stepped toward the door, moving to take the mask off, "Well, fine. I'll be done there as soon as I..."

.... The mask was missing.
145321.title: A Mask Gone Missing

choices: Alex runs into Reality there, but no fight comes with it.
Alex runs into some person he's not met before.
1453211.content:
"Alex? What's wrong?"

"It's.... It's a long story. After I get done with that I'll drop in and see if you can get your folks to take a look at it."

Still was definitely worrying, however. The first thought was to search the floor for it, in case it had fallen off, but no immediate sign of it. Plus it made no sense for him to have not noticed it falling off.

"Alex? Whatever it is we should probably hurry up with it."

"Hey, what's one quick fight first?" With a bit of an uneasy grin, Alex assured her, "I'll get dressed and get right down there. Don't remember what color I last dyed the costume, but you know the usuals."
1453211.title: One Mask is Gone, but Time For Another

choices: Alex responds by punching the stranger in the face.
Reality begins making.... oddly sexual small talk.
14532111.content:
"You've been dying it? I thought you just made spares."

"Yeah, that's money well spent." Putting his mouth-gaurd as Starchild back into place, Alex remarked, "Tell your boys to expect me at HQ. I won't be long."

"Understand."

From there, Alex leapt into his car, pulling out and heading downtown.... As he neared the point of the ruckus, the sounds of screams and explosions reached his ears.... Ready for action, he parked about a block away and stepped out...

Only to be face-to-face with Reality.

"You again..." Frowning, he shot out, "Didn't the old lady cut you loose?"

"Old lady doesn't know what's good."

To the vigilante's surprise, the blowhard struck a kind of smug, casual pose, grinning, "Does Starchild know those things?"
14532111.title: Reality Checks You Out

choices: The conversation continues, Alex a bit cautious.
Alex drops his guard, and gets a Reality Check for it.
145321112.content:
"Heh. Well, in certain respects. I thought your depiction of me was okay, for one, though might have been better had that script not limited you. I wouldn't give a speech on good and evil for one, morality's subject and I have friends who break plenty of laws." Arms crossing, the blond asked, "What's got you doing all this?"

"Got this package." Unusual enough on its own, but then the man explained further, "I won't go too into detail on what was in it, doubt you care, but it was labelled as being from Eighth Sin and a friend of mine got very sick from it. I usually don't act alone... or this blatantly."

"Yes, yes, all well and good. I'm going to have to stop you - you do realize that, don't you?"

Alex was rather surprised when that was met with a smirk and an oddly casual, "I've stopped, haven't I?"
145321112.title: Small Talk

choices: "Damn, I want to punch you."
"If it'll shut you up, would you go out on a date with me?"
1453211121.content:
"Yeah, but not for the reasons I expected...." Replied Alex, looking over the enemy in bewilderment. "You want to duke it out or you gonna leave?"

"Maybe I haven't decided yet...." Putting one hand on Dorothy's car and leaning on it, he asked, "If somebody told me Eighth Sin had women like you around, I might've attacked way earlier."

"Women like me can kick your ass," replied Alex, folding his arms. "That the kind of night you had in mind?"

"Who knows?" Grinning, Reality replied, in the most smarmy way possible, "I'm pretty good at taking it rough."

Alex opened his mouth to respond.....
1453211121.title: Chat With Reality

choices: Harena of Sand
Bowen Kodzo
Night Terror
Venusus
One
15.title: Blues

choices: Meanwhile with the intruders. . .
Harena wastes no time and brews up a sandstorm.
Before attacking, she decides to go observe.
151.content:
This would not do. . .

Harena of Sand was always a calm, collected individual, but this was one rare situation that gave her reason to be alarmed, if not outright panic.

"No, this is not good. . . Not good. . ."

Her task was to keep the secrets hidden under the sand exactly that, and she always found it easiest to do that living in complete isolation. Every now and then the stray passerby went through the stretch of desert she had set her spells to watch and guard, but she would let them come and go as they pleased if she sensed no particular power from them.

Then there was the occasional magic user, but this was different.

At least thirty bodies, almost all of them of some immense power. . .

"No, I have to stop this."

If there were that many people in her area at once and all with abilities the average human was not even aware existed much less in possession of, then she was going to be in for the fight of her life to fulfill her duty.

And there was the good chance there were others where they came from, and if so she could not let them out alive.
151.title: Intruders

choices: Try to scare them off for starters. They are children after all.
An invading army is too suspicious. Attack at once.
Retreat for now. Wait until she has surprise. Summon up a sandstorm to escape.
1513.content:
Blending in with the sand and sky, the guardian slunk closer and closer to the intruders. Most seemed a fair distance away from home, but one was getting ever-so-dangerously near. Perhaps she should pick that one off and see if it would serve as a warning to the rest of the small army.

As she came closer however, she only grew perplexed. The intruder in question, though possessing power most inhuman, was a small boy. Dressed in red, kicking up sand as he wandered slightly away from the group. Perhaps it would be easy to frighten him away and leave it at that. Or would that only notify the rest of his army into attacking?

But before she could come onto any decision, another child darted into view, catching up with, overtaking, and blocking off the wayward boy all in the same second. A dust-cloud rose from behind her as she moved, darting easily over the dunes faster then a hare.

"Nicky!" cried the girl, appearing in front of him. "What're you doing here? It's dangerous to wander off like that."

"Eheh... Sorry." The boy's face turned blue, which Harena at once assumed to be a trick of the bright light and blazing heat. "I just thought I saw one of those lizards. Like, the ones who have to stand on one foot to keep from getting hot? Those're neat."

"Well, sorta," admited the hare-child, turning the boy around to push him back to the rest of the group over the dune, "But you could've really been in trouble wandering off like that. Valerie was really-"

"NICKY!"

Appearing off the dune were too more children, running toward the ones already plainly seen Harena stared suspiciously at them as they arrived, sensing the same powers as the two who just appeared.

"You want to explain what you were doing running off like that?!" Demanded the larger one in a loud, carrying tone. "I shouldn't have to watch you ever minute we're on these stupid field trips!"

"Well, I-"

Wapping the boy lightly over the head (which made his back bend strangely, noted Harena), the girl shouted, "You could've been biten by a rattlesnake or gotten lost where we couldn't find you!"

"Or you could've died up and gotten hard like when you leave Silly Putty out of its egg," noted the other boy with a smile.
