"Oh, shut up Andy," demanded the tallest child there, grabbing the smallest by the straps of his clothes, "C'mon. You're going-"

"Uh... Guys?"

The other children were all in the process of walking back but the redhead had stopped. Harena wasn't sure why until he rose a finger, pointing directly at her, asking aloud, "You guys see that?"

She'd been spotted!
1513.title: Before attacking, she decides to go observe.

choices: Hareena finds a place to hide, and starts to prepare herself.
From the storm, one of the kids emerges at a blinding speed.
15133.content:
The fact that Hareena kept her skin covered and her clothes were primarily a sandy brown usually helped with observing from afar, but these people seemed to have caught her site; likely a result of the white parts.

"Um. . ." The small one stepped forward as if trying to study for sure whether or not he was looking at a person. After craning his neck in what struck the witch as a very unnatural-looking way, he gave a, "Hi?"

This couldn't happen.

Under the mask that covered her mouth and nose, Harena began to mumble frantically. No sense getting into a fight yet, but even if she had been spotted she couldn't risk them coming after her. . . Once the woman finished, a wind picked up from nothing, and soon sand began to whip about all over in a blinding frenzy.

She could hear shouts of surprise and confusion behind her, but as she set to running across the sand in the opposite direction Harena could not be bothered to care; she had to get to somewhere else in the area, maybe construct a fort of sand or something to hold herself up in. She had a war to fight if she was going to fulfill her duty.
15133.title: Retreat

choices: A thousand-year-old dagger containing the Sands Of Time.
An ax that summons Hellfire.
151331.content:
As she fled the scene, Haruna could feel out of the children following her before having to retreat due to the severity of the sandstorm she left in her wake. Going beneath the surface of the desert, the guardian flew silently through the cool, underground sand until she arrived back at the ruins. Rising up inside one of the floor-less buildings, she began to hear toward her holy artifacts.

Almost all the items, due to their already-delicate nature being weakened by time, were never to be touched, used, or tampered with, in spite of their magical power. However, there did remain a small number in the ruins that could be used by Haruna on a common basis. Two of them were purprosed toward the upkeep and maintenence of the city, but five were weapons. And of those five, two were magically inclined.

As the guardian removed these items from the casings in the same way one would handle special-occation antique china, her eyes skimmed over her two options. One was going to let her attack the invading child army....
151331.title: Artifacts In The Sand

choices: Fighting breaks out at once between the guardians and the invaders.
The rest of the school, Jake included, hear the commotion and investigate.
1513311.content:
"Don't wander off again," noted Valerie, dragging her little brother along by the straps of his overalls. "I don't wanna have Grant go up to do aerial recon."

"Aw, it's not like he'd mind..." whined out the six-yaer-old weakly. As he rejoined the group at large, and his own little clique of friends in particular, he asked the taller of the two blondes, "Wouldja, Nicky?"

"Nah." The flier smilied a little as he got a hug out of his answer, "Actually if you get up high enough it gets pretty cool."

"That sounds great right now..." grumbled out Lore, sipping on a juicebox. "I don't even get why Stickset brought us here beyond it being cheap."

"Well, what I heard was..." noted Andy with a grin, leaning on his best friend's shoulder, "That there was an ancient civilization here like a thousand years ago. Heh. What say we take Grant and Jenny out to try and find it? There could be like Aztec gold somewhere."

"I might be up for it if it didn't involve trudging along in the hot sun all day long," replied Lore, sipping her juice. "But as it is, I just wanna get back in the bus as soon as possible."

"For once my powers actually come in handy for my everyday life," grumbled out Valerie. "I can't believe you guys are complaining so much- I barely feel anything."

"That is a big perk, huh?" Noted Jenny with a smile, happy to see her friend happy with her powers for once. "Heheh... Hey, Nicky, you like being in the hot sun more then in the snow?"

"Uh-huh!" The elastic boy nodded enthusiastically, "I don't like being hot, but when it's cold I get frozen up all ov-"

"INVADERS!"

The six children, slightly apart from their group, turned to spot a woman in dust-colored clothes standing between a part in the dunes. Raising a hand above her head and grasping in it a bronze dagger, she proclaimed, "Face now Harena of the Sand and the Blade Of Ages!
1513311.title: The Blade Of Ages

choices: The group begins to fuss over Grant, trying to make sure he's okay.
One of the center's adults comes to see what happened.
15133111.content:
"Um. . ." That was Nicky, though as he exchanged glances with his friends they all seemed to be equally confused. Finally, he asked, "What're you doing out here?"

"I am protecting sacred land." That was growled out in a way very at odds with the cheerful smile on the boy's face as he asked, before the woman announced proudly, "I know that you've brought an army. . . But I've brought a tool that can take down ten fleets if it must be done."

That led to long period of awkward stares from the group of kids in general, which Harena judging by her expression - what little could be seen between her hair, mask, and scarf - mistook for fear. It was finally Lore who spoke up to ask, "Okay, are you suffering from sun stroke or something?"

"You wish, but those in my line train many years for this life."

"Okay, crazy woman. . . Look, we're just here because our bus broke down and --"

"I will protect the legends under the sands!"

With that proclaimation, the woman came rushing in with the dagger in hand. The first reaction was for Jenny to come moving for her; that was thwarted when the sand under her feet almost immediately dropped her into a pit. Of course, following that the next line of defense was both the second-fastest and the one who could avoid ground-based traps.

Unfortunately, though, when Grant flew in close enough he found the dagger plunged into his shoulder. This did not bring as much pain as one would expect, and when the blade was removed little blue blood came with it, but the woman explained, "Now, I take my leave. This boy's curse will spread to everyone who carries the same line of magic as you do."

The next second, a heavy blow of wind and sand swept over Harena; when it passed, she was gone.
15133111.title: Blood on the Sand

choices: The group finds they're dressed in clothes from the 1800s.
Grant begins a very slow regression.
151331111.content:
"Ugh! Great!" Covering her eyes as the sand blew over the group, Valerie soon lowered her gaze again, "Andy, where'd she go?"

"No idea..." Replied the redhead, shaking the sand out of his hair. "I think she might've dashed off northwest of here, but it's hard to tell with all this sand."

As that went on, the other available members of the group tended to their wounded boy, who drifted slowly onto the ground. Grant was at once greeted by Nicky wrapping an elastic arm around the dark-blue stain growing through his shirt and crying, concerned, "Does it hurt? Does it hurt?"

"Yeah, but..." As the boy waited a moment, his knees on the ground, his wince got slowly easier, "It's... It's not really that bad... In fact it feels like it's getting better."

"Hm." Stepping toward the boy, Lore simply ordered, "Nicky, take your hand off for a second." Once that was done, the six-year-old easily slipped her hand through Grant's neck hole and felt the point of impact, at once noting, "There's no puncture wound- it's closed off."

"What?" As Grant got uneasily back to his feet, Nicky said in awe, "But he's got all that blood on-"

"That Dagger was probably enchanted." Replied Lore, addressing the whole group. Looking over her shoulder, she spotted Jenny hopping, rabbit-like, out of the whole with her powerful legs. "That makes it even worse- there could be a curse on you now for all we know."

"A curse?" That was more then Grant needed. "But... what kind of curse?"

"That's terrible!" Zipping at once to the boy's side, Jenny felt the bloody part of his clothes before asking, "Grant, do you feel any different? Are you sick? Woozy?"
151331111.title: Inspecting Songbird

choices: Grant quickly alerts his teammates to what happened.
Even as the regression becomes obvious, the others don't seem to notice.
1513311112.content:
"Um. . ." With all of these people fussing over him and the slight, albeit not very extreme, pain in his shoulder, Grant found it a little hard to focus on what did or did not feel normal.

After a second of mulling it over, though, he answered, "No, I think I'm okay. . ."

"Well, we can't be too careful." Lore crossed her arms, as she explained, "Let's go get Jake and let him know what happened, maybe he can call like that ditsy friend of his or something to come check on it."

"Yeah, sounds good. . ."

Grant got to walking then, as did the others; he could not help but notice, though, that his boot felt unusually spacious as he took a step.
1513311112.title: Slow Regression

choices: The regression virus begins to spread to Nicky.
Grant's behavior starts to reflect his declining status.
15133111121.content:
Grant instinctively began floating, looking cautiously at his shoes, "Uh... Guys?"

"Dunno why we're so worried," grumbled out Valerie, a bit of nerves untangling inside her as she walked back. "There's no such thing as magic."

"Heh..." Patting the taller girl on the shouderl, Jenny happily asked, "Normally for Martina you can argue that, but I'd like to know how that cut in Grant's shoulder just disappeared."

"Guys?"

Andy opened his mouth to retort but Lore cut him off, "Let's not do the stupid magic fight now. We can have the stupid magic fight when we're in the air conditioned bus. Jake-"

"GAH!"

The rest of the group turned in surprise to spot Grant's clothes hanging loosely on him. His shoes had already fallen off into the sand, but the thing that made him cry out loud what the fact that his jeans fell with them.
15133111121.title: Rapidly Shrinking Birdie

choices: The kids quickly gather what's going on and begin to discuss solutions.
Before things can go too far, they are found by another kid from the group.
151331111211.content:
While the first reaction of Nicky and Andy was to start giggling as their fellow boy rushed to get one hand to both the front and the back of his boxers to keep them in place, they both quickly stopped. As they did, Valerie groaned out, "Well, at least we didn't have to make it clear how serious this is. . ."

"Y-Yeah, not a good time for laughing. . ."

Face a bright blue as he felt his underwear growing steadily wider to the touch and his height now about on par with Lore, Grant squeaked out, "Yeah, we need to hurry and --"

"Whoa. . ."

That came from Nicky, who everyone else's eyes quickly turned to. He was holding his head and his overalls looked just so slightly bigger on him, as he explained, "I feel kind of weird."
151331111211.title: Group Regression

choices: The other kids begin to manifest problems.
One of the kids has a sudden accident.
1513311112111.content:
"Ohhhh, crap." Eyes went to Andy then, and while he was apparently still himself, he summed up, "This is gonna spread to all of us now. That lady said it would effect everyone who shared out magic..."

"But we're not magical!" Squeaked out Grant, swaying a little as he floated in mid-air, "Our powers are totally science-based!" As he began to inspect himself further, his face turned an even brighter Blue, "Lookit this! What'm I gonna do for clothes! I feel like-"

"Grant, calm down!" The boy was quieted when he was hugged warmly by the group's speedster, who held him closely against her chest. "It's alright. We can settle this, okay?"

"Right." Stepping forward, Lore demanded, "Whatever that dagger did, and whoever that woman is, she just dug her grave- nobody does that to us." Turning to Valerie and Andy on her left, she added, "I still think we need to talk to Jake but we can't let this spread beyond us. The sooner we find her the better."

"Heh... Well, in that case we better get moving, it's a big desert but..." Andy took a second glance at both Grant and Nicky, the latter of whom was starting to hold up his overalls before mentioning, "Huh... I don't think they're shrinking though- they loko like they're getting younger. Good thing too, since if it was shrinking, Lore would disappear once it spread to h- OW!."

"YOunger?!" Nicky pouted visibly, one hand letting go of his overall straps to have its palm inspected, "But I'm already the youngest! I can't get any worse!"

"Don't talk like that!" Putting one hand on her brother's head, Valerie insisted, "Listen, nothing bad is gonna happen to you- we're gonna track that woman down and I'll personally burn her hair off until she gives us a cuRE!"

As she finished her sentence, Valerie's height took a serious blow and her voice went up almost a whole octave.
1513311112111.title: Blue Assessment

choices: The regression continues across the whole group.
Mental effects begin to come into play.
15133111121111.content:
"Well, thith day jutht getth bettuh and bettuh, huh?" In spite of the situation and the lisp Andy was grinning as he said that. . . until, after a moment, it dawned on him exactly what was going on. "Well, gweat!"

"Heheh. . ." Though his best friend started chuckling a bit at that, after a moment she stopped and said, "Well, guess this is probably going to fall to me then. Since this sort of thing doesn't really --"

It was Jenny who interrupted her, with nothing beyond a sheepish, "Uh, Lore?"

Soon as she heard her name, the sole fair-skinned brunette member of the team turned to look down at herself and noticed her dress seeemed to totally hide the shorts she wore underneath from view now.
15133111121111.title: The other kids begin to manifest problems.

choices: Jenny's hit next, of course.
Jenny's effects aren't physical.
151331111211111.content:
"Oh, just GREAT!" Now at eye-level with her already-diminishing brother, Valerie growlde out, "Now that crazy woman's just asking for it!"

"I know! I know!" Inspecting herself even more thorughly, Lore soon found she had to reach under her dress to keep her shorts and pony underwear from sliding down her legs, "Okay... I here's what we're gonna do. Grant? Can you still fly?"

"Uh..." Face still blue from being cuddled by Jenny, Grant eventually nodded, "Uh-huh. Think I can still do it pretty good..."

"Hey, quick quesshun," asked Andy momentarily, pointing at the speedster of the group, "Why'sh Jenny not gettin' younguh too?"

"Eheh... I probably will in a second or something," noted the blond worriedly. "Don't jinx it."
151331111211111.title: Ever Shrinking Blues

choices: The kids try to explain to Jake what's going on.
Grant and Jenny try to use their speed to get away and find Harena.
1513311112111111.content:
In fact, within seconds of the response coming in Jenny's height took a noticeable hit. While she didn't do anything but move at blinding speed to grab for her own shorts for whenever she inevitably got small enough for them to start to fall, Lore's response was to turn her head back to Grant and explain, "Okay, what you need to do is go fly to Jake and --"

"Well, this is the sort of thing I should have expected."

"Strike that."

The voice was familiarly that of the janitor, sounded as mildly annoyed over this as he did over seemingly everything else. As the regressions of Grant and Nicky seemed to stop leaving them around two and one years old respectively, the others were also very quickly losing their age; it was Valerie, at present the fourth youngest in the group - fourth only because Lore had less to lose than she did, though, given the speed she was going at - who shouted, "This stupid witch person came and --"

"Ugh." With his hand going to the ridge of his nose, Jake asked, "Alright, which of you got the idea to go running off and stripping in the middle of the desert? And where'd you get those clothes anyway?"
1513311112111111.title: Jenny Regresses and Jake Arrives

choices: Jake doesn't listen and drags them off to the bus
Jake begins to dress the kids out of a diaper bag he had on hand.
15133111121111111.content:
"No! Mister Jake!" Before she could zip over to the janitor, Jenny first had to hop out of her overly-large sneakers, which led to a humorous look on her face when her feet touched the hot sand. Ignoring it at once, she zipped over to the grown-up, one hadn still holding her bicycle shorts, "Mister Jake, these aren't our clothes! We just got attacked by this crazy woman and Grant got stabbed and-"

"What?" Turning, Jake took in the tinier blond, now floating in mid-air, his shirts covering him like a gown and his feet barely peeking out from beneath. Taking in the blue blood soaked into the cloth, he at once cried, "Stabbed? What happened?"

"Well-"

"Grant!" The flier's attention was taken by Lore pointing at him demandingly, "Now that Jake's ehre, get into the air. Once you're as high as you can get, try and spot anything about where that crazy lady lives. Then come right back."

In spite of her dress becoming steadily larger on her frame, Lore still carried a very demanding presense, and Grant nodded in response before zooming up into the sky.

"Alright..." Getting on one knee to address the kids better, but seeming no less annoyed, Jake aksed, "What's going on here? I told you lot specifically not to leave the other kids and now you're all here doing I-don't-know what!"

"Crazy lady stabbed Grant, then we started to regress and-"

Before Lore could do her basic sum-up, she briefly took her hands off her shorts, causing them to slide, along with her underwear, off her thighs and into the sand. Fortunately her dress was long enough to hide her body, but she nonetheless turned blue at the feeling, "Okay, new plan- I'll explain it if you can get us some clothes that fit."
15133111121111111.title: New Wardrobe Needed Badly

choices: The kids make one more desperate attempt to persuade Jake.
The group gives up and instead decides to wait and prepare to defend themselves.
151331111211111111.content:
"What happened to the clothes you were wearing?" With one hand to his forehead as the other rested against his bent knee, Jake groaned, "Look, whatever. All of you need to get back to the bus so I can get being chewed out finished as soon as possible, then we'll worry about clothes and getting out of this desert."

"Wait, what do you think is --"

Before Valerie could finish that question, the janitor turned his head up to the sky and shouted to Grant, "And you get down here too! A baby flying around is enough of a problem without you having your diaper on."

Jenny was the only one whose regression had not quite finished yet, but even as hers slowly went on Jake iddn't seem to notice a difference. Instead, he picked up the two smallest ones in Nicky and Lore each in their bundle of clothes within one of his arms, then said, "The rest of you, follow, and don't go wandering off again."
151331111211111111.title: Back to the Bus

choices: Jake agrees and takes them to get dressed
Jake blows them off and takes the kids back kicking and screaming.
1513311112111111111.content:
"But Mister Jake!" Zipping in front of the janitor and cutting him off, Jenny hastily began to explain, "You hafta understand- we're not babies! Whatever that dagger did, we're all kids! Even Lore and Nicky are six!"

"Uh-huh."

Jake casually moved past the girl in pigtails, heading toward the bus and eltting the kids follow him. EVen Grant, for his part, floated down beside him.

"Jake, ya gotta listen!" Using her strength, Lore was at least able to manuver herself differently and glare up at the janitor, squeaking out, "That lady's gonna come back! She's probably jus' waiting 'til all the kids are like this, then she's gonna try an' wipe us out!"

"Ah." Looking down at the super-strong toddler, Jake replied, "So tehre's some murderous witch who did this and I'm just not aware."

"Uh-huh!" Grant nodded, pointing out into the desert, "I could see 'dis village 'er town in th' desert, made outta rock..."

"C'mon, Mister Jake..." Tugging on the janitor's pant leg, Andy blinked up at him cutely, asked, "Pwease? We twust you wif' aww kindsa stuff, so you c'n twust us, wight?"
1513311112111111111.title: Appealing To The Murphy

choices: The mention of diapers causes a fit.
The kids reluctantly agree to go along with it for now.
15133111121111111111.content:
There was a long, awkward silence in response. After a moment, though, Jake met that with a heavy sigh that was followed by, "Fine, whatever. Weirder things have happened."

"Great!" After Grant explained this, he floated right around to face the adult directly, shirts still hanging off of him and at this point possibly taller than he was. "We p'obably gotsa hurry 'cause dat lady said --"

"Wait, wait."

While he couldn't put a hand to his face with a baby in each arm, Jake certainly wanted to. In either case, however, he explained, "We're not going anywhere until we go back to the bus and at least grab some diapers. I am not going through walking through the desert while some of you bawl because you wet yourself, got it?"
15133111121111111111.title: Going For Clothes

choices: The kids are brought back and meet Heather and Tracey
Valerie begins to pitch  a fit over that fact.
151331111211111111112.content:
"D-Diapies?" Feeling his eagerness at being trusted flying out from under him, Grant mumbled out, "B-But..."

"Heheh. Well, it's not wike we coudlnn' use some cwothes..." Andy let go of his waistline, grinning as his pants feel into the sand and leaving him in his too-large shirt and underwear, "I guess it's betta 'den us goin' 'wound half-nakie!"

"Yeah, yeah... Jake, lemme down!"

Lore hopped clusmily out of Jake's hands, her dress thankfully staying attachted as she landed into the sand. Nicky for his part stayed in the janitors arms have gave him a snuggle taht he didn't outwardly react to.

"Uh... Misser Jake?" cooed out the elastic boy kidnly, "Umm... We're not all gonna wear diapies, are we?"

"Don't worry, replied the jantior with a blunt shrug as they stepped between two sand-dunes to the bus, "We've got your training pants ready for you."
151331111211111111112.title: No Arguing With It When You're Babies

choices: Tracey and Heather are younger than normal, and see nothing wrong.
The two are their normal age, and don't know why their friends are babies.
1513311112111111111121.content:
"Hey, wait!" That was the boy's oldest sister, looking offended as she along with the rest of the group approached the bus. "Why's he get --"

"Wha?"

That voice sounded familiar, but it wasn't any of the adults in the group. Instead, up ahead the group of toddlers took into sight the pair of Tracey and Heather apparently in the middle of conversing, the former being the one to speak out.

As the two began to approached, though, it was the latter - as her eyes landed on her roommate - who asked, "Um. . . Wh-What happened to all of you?"
1513311112111111111121.title: Slightly Bigger Kids

choices: The kids wait quietly for Jake to get back.
One of the kids begins to suddenly cry.
15133111121111111111211.content:
"This crazy lady in the desert," replied Lore without missing a beat. Rushing forward to meet with the other kids, Lore found to her slight surprise they both lokoed to be about five. "Now look at us."

"Uh-huh." Apparently these two were out of the loop as well, since Tracy rolled its eyes and replied, "Whatever. This is why I don't play with babies..."

"We're not babies!" Squeaked out Valerie, clutching her clothes around herself. When Nicky was placed next to her, and she found to her horror he was slightly taller, she turned insistently to Heather, "You wouldn't believe what I've just been through."

"I-I understand, Val..." Very careful not to have her hand lite up, Heather reached forward and patted her friend on the head.

"Okay, Tracey, we're gonna go get this lot the spare clothes in their bags." Comomn thing to bring around for babies. Turning to Lore, Jake demanded, "Wait right here and don't move. I'm willing to give this a chance, but you're not going anywhere in this without me."

"Agreed."

As the janitor and boy-girl walked off, Andy stepped forward, "You guys notice Tracey's voice didn't change that much as she got younger."

"Kinda," replied Lore. "Not sure if that hints more toward one side or the other, though."

"Hmph." Jenny pouted cutely, "I think it's rude to talk about it..."
15133111121111111111211.title: Kindergarten Blue Students

choices: Jake gets back, and the group gets on their way.
Things are interrupted when one of the kids has an accident.
151331111211111111112111.content:
"Yeah, whatever." No sense arguing on this right now. Instead, Lore with a sigh turned her eyes to Grant and inquired, "Ya think ya could remember the way back to that village?"

"Uh huh! S'not dat far from here or nuttin'." With a grin in spite of the situation, Grant said, "Dunno how many people she's got wiff'er or nothin', dough. . ."

A fair point. As the group mulled that over, though, Andy volunteered, "Didn't sensh moredun her or nuttin'."

"Not a guarantee, but a good sign." With her arms crossed over her chest as best she could manage with her undeveloped body, Lore continued, "And she did say somefin' about 'one person takin' down an army'."
151331111211111111112111.title: Waiting for Jake

choices: Tracey begins teasing the kids over their status.
Grant begins crying over the accident.
1513311112111111111121112.content:
"One person could jus' mean her..." Now averaging out to about the same size as Nicky, "If we're lucky that'll be the case an' it'll be an easy fight."

"Yeah." Andy snickered, turning to his best friend and giving her a thumbs up, "Cwassic six-vuhsus-one butt-kikcery stratuhgy?"

"We can only hope." Thining about her situation, Lore reached over and easily picked the redhead up with one hand. "Good. I was 'fwiad we'd be powuhwess too. I guess since Stickset ain't here I c'n deal wif' bein' a baby fer a hour or so..."

"Yeah, I'm jus' gwad Awish isnn' here," replied Andy with a shrug.

"Heheh..." Feeling a little special being the tallest, Nicky bent down a little to speak to the two babies. "Well, ifit helps, you guy's're really cute right now. You're all cuddly and stuff."

"Yeah, yaeh." Lore put a hand on the elastic boy's check and gently moved it away, "Look it a mirror sometime- you's not too big yerself."

"Uh-huh." Grant floated just beside Nicky, his legs kicking a little, "You're pwobwy jus' big 'nuff for twainuhs..."

"Compahed ta you we're all big," snickered out Andy, looing at the tiny bird. "'Fink you came out tiniest of us all- you's all- EW!"

The redhead hopped back, the other kids doing the same when a light splatter of urine hit the sand, the source being Grant.
1513311112111111111121112.title: Bird Incontinence

choices: The babies try and explain the situation, with predictable results.
Another kid walks by, who seems to not yet be under these effects.
15133111121111111111211121.content:
"Ew!" While that sound could've come from any one of them, and indeed every member of the group carried varying levels of disgust, it was Nicky who made the explanation.

The reply from the boy who did it, meanwhile, was a quick, mortified, "H-How'dya think I feel?"

"Still!" After that shout and then a groan from the one black girl in the group, she went on to complain, "We'd better find that woman an' blow her head right off'er --"

"What're you all going on about?" A quick turn upward and to the right from where the babies sat revealed Tracey, still standing around with his or her arms behind his or her head, "I bet it's just some dumb imagination stuff."
15133111121111111111211121.title: Teasing the Babies

choices: Tracey suddenly suffers the effects of the spell as well.
Grant overhears that detail on Starchild and tries to question it.
151331111211111111112111211.content:
"Hmph." Turning a cold-shoulder to the genderly-ambiguous kindergartener, Lore admitted, "It'sh pwobwy gonn' sound wike 'magination ta you, but we're not weawy babies. We got turned 'dat way by a wady who wives out in da desert. She hurt Gwant wiffa dagger an' now we's wike 'dis."

"Uh-huh." Rolling her eyes, Tracey lokoed to Jenny to explain, "Sounds like something from that Dorothy show you wathc. Um... What's it called... Starchild."

"Wha..." Starchild's name wasn't.... Oh, whatever. Shrugging off the bigger kid, Jenny took a hold of one of Grant's toys and pulled him, balloon-like, away from the wet part of the sand, "Eheh... It's okay, Grant. Misser Jake'll be back soon with some diapers."

"I-Is 'zat 'sppossa make be feel bettuh?"
151331111211111111112111211.title: "That Dorothy Show"

choices: Tracey freaks out and runs off.
Now convinced, Tracey asks to come along for resolving things.
1513311112111111111121112111.content:
"Well t'least you'll be clean, right?" Well, Jenny had a point there. Still, Grant opted not to say anything, instead being content to at least mostly be away from the urine on the sand. "Dunno if we c'n beat her like dis though," the girl continued once that subject was resolved, back to the most important point at the moment, "Mosta us are kinda limited. . ."

"Still bet one punch from me would knock her lights out," Lore declared, before giving a point over to Grant and Jenny with one hand and Valerie with the other, "And if she tries a sandstorm or somefin' you two've got dat covered, while if punching doesn't work 'splosions sure will."

"Cute."

Evidentally the kindergartner of indeterminent gender wasn't quite finished with this subject, as he said, "Hope you know Mr. Jake's probably. . . W-Wait."

Something seemed off, like Tracey had a stomachache or something. It took a moment before anyone gathered what exactly was going on, until hir clothes seemed to be ever-so-slightly baggier and led Andy to guess, "Looksh likeya spent a lttuh too much time 'wound us, huh?"
1513311112111111111121112111.title: Little Boy and / or Girl

choices: The kids try to get Tracey to come back before she/he infects the other Blues.
Lore suddenly has an accident of her own.
15133111121111111111211121111.content:
"Tr-Tracey?!" Now alarmed, Heather looked form her younger roommate to the shrikning girl-boy. Her head briefly sparking flames like a lighter, she squeaked out, "Are you oka-"

"Heather!" Raising a hand warning to her best friend, Valerie warned slowly, "You get back, okay? Go uh... Go play with the other kids."

"Um..." Looking at the infant she shared a room with, Heather gave a slow nod before rushing to meet with Mr. Jake.

That left the toddlers alone together, and Andy smugly patting the boy-girl on the back, "Heheh.... Not so fun ebing a baby huh?" Tugging at his shirt, Andy briefly mentioned, "I can't 'memba eva teasin' Awish 'bout it, but if I did, gonna 'palagize to her 'bout it anyway."

"Sure she'll be thrilled." Lore helped Tracey to his/her feet, remarking, "Look, Jakey'll be back with some diapies for us, an' 'den-"

"Hey!" Blinking at the other babies with wide innocent eyes, Tracey squeaked out, "You's mean, I'ma pway wif' Petuh!"

The next moment, the Blue baby dashed off, leaving the others even more confused in its wake. After a momen,t Nicky broke the silence, "Awww... I kinda thought maybe I could see her gettin' changed so I'd know what she was."

"NICKY!"
15133111121111111111211121111.title: A Cuter, Sweeter Boy/Girl

choices: Lore grows angry, and Jake returns right on time.
The leader's first response is to bawl her eyes out.
151331111211111111112111211112.content:
"W-Wait. Wait. . ." While fine to let the boy-girl go for the moment, Grant seemed to have something occur to him after a second of pondering on the subject. He quickly explained afterward, "We should keep 'im or.... her, or whateva away from da others!"

"Huh? Why not?"

Jenny asking, but the others didn't seem to have it immediately click for them in general what the problem was. Grant wasted no time in explaining, "He got littler by bein' cwoseta us, wight? So if he's wiff da udders. . ."

"Eh, why worry 'bout it?" With a shrug, Lore explained, "If we gets dis fixed in a hurwy it won't mattuh. And if it takes awhile, hey, we won't be the only ones that's gotta wear diapies."

The first to chime in was Valerie, with an immediate, "Won't hear we compwainin'." The next sound contributed after her, though, came faintly from the group leader's bowels.
151331111211111111112111211112.title: Leader's Accident

choices: The kids notice Jake seems to be about ten.
Jake sets to work changing Lore before they can head into the desert.
1513311112111111111121112111121.content:
"GAH!" Making an almost-comical squeak as her waste left her body, Lore felt even worse when it fell into her baggy underwear and required her to hold it up to keep them from falling from the weight. A quiet hush came over the desert as Lore felt everyone staring at her.

"Uh... Lore?" Inching away from the baby, Jenny asked, "Eheh.. Didjoo jus'-"

"Yes." Speaking in a final, definative manner, Lore replied, "Yes. I just crapped myself. You all know it. I'm putting it out there. There are not going to be any jokes. There are not going to be any jabs. We are not going to talk aobut it now. Maybe, if I'm in a good mood on the bus wide back when we's big 'gain, we c'n talk 'bout it, but if any of ya mentions it, I'ma pick you up an' shake you."

The kids all seemed to take this threat to heart, but it was subverted hard when JJake returned form the bus, a heavy bag over his shoulder, and sniffed the air, "Ugh. Great, I knew I was gonna come back too late. Which one of you was it?"
1513311112111111111121112111121.title: Angry Baby, Disgruntled Janitor

choices: The celebration is interrupted by a drop-in by the police.
Right on cue, Kodzo receives word that his men's first job in town was foiled.
Meanwhile with someone who could scratch Bowen Kodzo....
152.content:
When the man with the trolley stopped in place and gave the word of, "That's the last crate, boss," he was met with a loud, jolly laugh.

"Great, great." With a grin on his face, the overweight, slightly goofy-looking crime boss took a look around the new warehouse; not as spacious as it could have been, but for the price he was plenty example with that. "It's a new town, boys. A new town away from all of those superpowered, costumed freaks."

He gave another pleased laugh then as he walked about, this time over to where a makeshift desk had been set up in the center of the room. Upon taking his seat, he withdrew a bottle of whisky, removed the top, and promptly took a drink straight from the bottle before saying, "And you can't spell 'freaks' without 'free'. Because we're free, boys!"

"Um, boss? 'Freaks' has --"

"You can't say it then, whatever!"

The man was in too good of spirits right now to let that interruption get to him, "This town is just big enough to be worth ruling, and we're free of those costumed clowns and superhuman stains! It's a joyous occasion, and the day this organization becomes just as invulnerable as the man myself."

He gave another good laugh, then, asking, "Gentlemen, speak honestly - do you think there could ever be anybody in Stonewall who could even scratch Bowen Kodzo?"
152.title: Bowen Kodzo

choices: Over at the scene of the bust, the kids are destroying the weapons.
Bowen sends his men into the scene first to try and stomp them out.
Bowen assembles his gang outside the heist site, demanding the kids exit.
1522.content:
"B-Boss!"

"Hm?" Bowen turned in an irritated fashion, looking over one of his green-clad henchmen. The figure was currently leaning into the doorframe, clutching an aching arm. Stomping toward the figure, Bowen asked, "What happened to you?"

"Shilo got pinched!"

Shilo Gill. An oddly subdued member of Bowen's gang who wore long hooded coats. At the news he'd been taken off, Kodzo's blood began to boil. Grabbing his henchmen's side and pulling him to sit on a heavy crate, he demanded, "I put Gill on that job specifically because he can stay quiet! How'd he ever get pinched?! Having a bunch of crates filled with guns isn't illegal in Texas!"

"They say the cops in Stonewall are nuts though, boss," piped up one of the smaller crew members. "Maybe they was just shoving they's wait around!"

"Nuh... No cops...." Panting from having run across town, the escaped member began to remove his green-painted bodyarmor. "Costumes..."

"ARGH! What're they doing? Follow me?!" Roaring in anger, Bowen stamped his foot, making an echoing boom. "Was it that pretty boy Marvelous Man?! Bring him on!"

"Didn't see..." Shaking his head and sitting up straighter on the crate, the henchman began to explain, "Shilo.. he-he saw a convinence store. Sent me out to get smokes... When I came back they was gettin' pinched. Heard them take the dog you gave 'em off the chain, then the dog just started yelping. Someone tried to run out to the car but this uh... I dunno, it was like a blur... Smacked him and carried him back. Didn't get a good look."

"Hmph." Didn't costumes usually love to show off? "Well, what did you see?"

"Uh..." To be honest, the henchmen was too afraid to examine the scene, although there was one thing. "Saw... Saw Shilo. Too dark to make it out, but one guy slipped off his coat and hung him unside-down from it for the cops... Then I looked over... In another room, uh... Didn't see who was inside but they was talking... One kept breaking the guns into pieces an' throwing them to the ground. Saw 'em fly past the door. Said they'd trash the whole shipment."

"The hell they will!" Rising to his full height, and even more imposingly, beginning to throw around his full weight, Bowen demanded to the group, "Get your guns, boys! I've had enough of these costumes running aorund in their underwear and messing with my business! Time to blow those retards all the way back to Georgia!" As the gang cheered, adrenaline rushing, he pulled up his gasoline and added, "And if they won't go, gonna burn their faces off!"
1522.title: Coming News Of Costumes

choices: Bowen decides to send in the dogs.
15222.content:
After traveling only six blocks, Bowen and his men stopped in front of the wearhouse they were getting the goods from. Sure enough, one of the men with a trained ear said he could make out noises of cracks and splinterings inside.

"Alright..." Feeling nice and tough, Bowen turned on his gang, demanding, "Gimme the horn! Let's get their attention!"

"Uh... Boss?" Looking reluctant, one of the heavily-armored members asked, "Don'tcha think that'll let the pigs know where we are?"

"Hmph." True, the big thing right now was to take care of those costumes... Stroking his cheek, Bowen reached into the trunk and retreived a shotgun. As the henchman caught it, he demanded, "Alright! You go in there and order those guys out! Tell them Bowen challenges them to a fight!"

"But..." Looking terrified, the henchman replied, "But boss, what if they've got powers?"

"Phft." Rolling his eyes, the figure replied, "Please. They're probably just idiots with no fashion sense! Like that shoeless blonde Ivy or the prancing-purple faggot Rayne! Get in there and get them out here!"

----

Work continued slowly on the shipment of guns, with Trace in the corner casually breaking them in half much as one would a bagette. As this continued, the other children conversed idly, mostly inspecting the tied-and-gagged ringleader.

Pushing the figure so he swung side-to-side from the ceiling, Nimble noted, "Okay, I know you're not into the street-clothes-are-my-costume thing-"

"Civilian Spandex," corrected Songbird.

"Right." Continuing, he added, "But I like the coat. It's pretty cool-looking!"

"I hate that too," replied Cannon in an annoyed voice. "Oh, just put on a trench coat and suddenly you look evil! It's not even threatening anymore since everybody does it. Not just comic books, everybody."

"Aww... but..." Rather admiring the garment himself, Putty tugged on it before adding, "It's got a hood on it. So it kinda hides you face and stuff."

"Yeah!" Grinning, Nimble poked at his mask, "Wouldn't it be cool if you just put the hood up and then a big mask that covers you whole face. It'd be more like a costume then."

"Hm. I guess," replied Songbird thoughtfully. "It'd make for easy changes to civilian identity since it'd be easy to take the coat and mask off and just wearing them over your clothes when you go out. Of course, you'd need to bundle it up over your clothes."

"Oh, that's barely a step over the hat-and-sunglasses-thing," replied Cannon with a roll of her eyes. "Is it really that hard to try to look interesting? Besides, it would be hard to fight if the coat was bundled up."

At that moment, Quickzip entered in from the next room, idly munching on a bag of potato chips, "Hey. What're we talking about?"

"Trenchcoats being stupid for fighting," answered Cannon.

Before her younger brother could argue against that point, he pointed to Quickzip's bag and asked, "Ooo, where'd you get those?"

"Found a mini-fridge in the other room. Want s-"

"FREEZE, COSTUMES!"

The five children turned in dull surprise, spotting the green-clad madman aiming a gun feverishly at their direction. After several moments of simple pointing and staring, the minion lowered the barrel of his weapon ever-so-slightly.

"Uh..." Looking over the five kids, he remarked, "What the... Did you guys take out Shilo? How old are-"

Before the stranger could ask his question, the smallest of the children there reached out toward him. So far out that his arm easily crossed the long hallway and wrapped, tentacle-like, around the gun. The next second it turned taunt and bounced back like a rubber band, pulling the shotgun out of his hands. That clear, the largest in the group rose her hand.

The henchmen was barely able to notice the glow before he was struck in the chest and slammed into the drywall behind him.
15222.title: Bowen sends his men into the scene first to try...

choices: The Blues kids head outside to meet their attackers.
Bowen finds Jake in his car waiting and attempted to take him for a hostage.
152221.content:
"What the hell's keeping him?!" Not known for his patience, Kodzo paced the entrance to the base, waiting some word or info from the man he sent inside. Finally fed up from waiting any longer, he pointed at the nearest minion, "Okay! Get the dogs! We'll tear those idiots to shreds!"

"You got it boss!"

The attack-dogs were taken from the back of the truck, and the henchmen present took turns carefully removing their muzzles. At once, the animals rushed out, ferocious toward the open door, fighting and tugging at the very end of their chains, their barking causing spits of heavy saliva. The chains were undone and they rushed feverishly inside.

----

"So there was one more?" asked Trace, hands on her hips.

"Uh-huh!" Putty nodded, handing the smaller girl a shotgun. "He shouted, "FREEZE COSTUMES" and then he-"

"I heard him." Trace took a moment to tie a knot into the barrel of the shotgun before rounding on her red-headed teammate, "Andy, when we got through this, you told me specifically there weren't any others."

"Eheh... Yeah, I know but..." Squirming guiltily, Nimble suggested, "Guess I missed one?"

"If we missed one, there could be more," replied Trace quietly. Turning to the other two girls present, she informed them, "Look, just to be safe, I want you two to search the rest of this place. If nothing else we could find moer guns or drugs or...."

The barking reached them, coming down the hall toward their location. Trace sighed, "Or dogs. I thought it was a little funny they would only have one. Grant?"

"Oh!" Jumping to attention, Songbird began to move apart from the group, toward te approaching animals. "Right..."

As the canines burst in, tripping over one another to find their prey, drooling and roaring all the way, Songbird too a deep breath through his nose. As they grew ever closer, he opened his mouth. No sound emanated, but at that exact second, the dogs stopped in their tracks. Stumbling to the ground, they proceeded to writhe and kick on the cold floor, whining and yelping all the while. The smarter ones crouched down and covered their ears, while one turned and bolted the way it came, but half of them simply ran about in torture.

"Ugh..." Averting her eyes, Quickzip noted, "I hate seeing this. The dogs didn't do anything wrong- They're only doing what their owners are telling them. We shouldn't have to hurt them like this."

"I get that," replied Trace, "But if we don't stop them they'll just attack us."

"Besides..." Cannon rose her hand, making it glow threateningly, "Grant doing the dog-whistle trick with his scream is clean. Wouldja rather I just zapped them until they limped off like we do with people?"

"Speaking of people..." Trace began to move closer to Songbird as he subdued the pack, "These dog's didn't just fall out of the sky. Someone let them loose." Narrowing her eyes behind her goggles, she added, "Whoever's behind them probably just sent reinforcements."

"Heheh..." Snickering, Nimble inched over to his best friend, asking snidely, "Time for a good old-fashioned manhunt, Boss?"

Grinning, Trace replied, "Exactly."
152221.title: Bowen decides to send in the dogs.

choices: Jake manages to fight the crime lord off long enough to escape.
Bowen and his boys easily overpower and capture Jake.
1522212.content:
As this occurred indoors, outside Bowen was left curious, peering in confusion at the building. "I don't get it....What happened to my dogs?!"

"H-Heard 'em whimpering, boss," mumbled out one of the minions. "These must be some big costumes."

"No duh, they're big costumes!" Growling bitterly, Bowen tried to think this over. Should he just go in? If they were realy big they could stomp him out. But he couldn't think like that! Real men don't feel fear! Bravity and gusto for the w-

"Uh... Boss?" Just before he was able to make his battle cry, Bowen heard his name called by one of his minions. "There's a guy nearby. Could be a cop..."

"A cop?" Confused, Bower ran a hand through his red hair. Great, costumes too. "Where is he?! We gotta show these pigs early on we don't play no games!"

"Uh... I dunno if it's really a cop," replied the minion's partner, looking away. "Just... Could be on stakeout or something. Sitting in his car."

"Hm...."

Curious, Bowen stood up and began to trod heavily toward the direction his boys pointed out to him. Just around the corner of the building was a car, sitting and turned off. Normally nothing to worry about, but in the drivers seat was a blond-haired man flipped boredly through a newspaper. Obviously waiting for something...

"Hmm..." Could the costumes have a police escort? Witness? Just enjoying the night air? Growling, Bowen looked to his men, who seemed wary. Taking the charge, he marched toward the car angrily.

"Hey!" Banging on the glass, he demanded, "BLONDIE!"

"Watch it!" Annoyed, the man inside rolled the window down, asking, "What's the problem? This private property?"

"I'm asking the questions!" Demanded the crime lord, shoving his face into the janitor's. "What're you doing here, stickly-man?!"

God, this guy's breath smelt like a dirty garage. Glaring, Jake turned his face slightly, "The crossword. If you can't tell me a six-letter-word for "Dragon," leave."
1522212.title: Loitering Janitor

choices: The children begin to trip and freak out.
Apart from the kids, Jake begins to suffer his out delusions.
Lore begins to suffer odd effects different from the rest.
154.content:
"Alight." The giant was stomping towards them with loud echoing footsteps, Trace glanced over her shoulder to the two other members of her group, "I can handle this. You two work on getting that door open."

"The hell you are!" Franklin's current body was that of a college football player, which coupled with his ability to enhance his hosts' strength to inhuman levels, left him a powerful opponent. But sadly, strength didn't account for skill, and even disregarding that, Lore was still the tougher of the two. When the masked man charged, the little girl anchored herself onto the floor and grabbed his outstretched arms, throwing him so hard that he flew through the window to the side. Looking through the broken portal showed him hurled all the way across the parking lot, his fall broken by the cars of one of Ferguza's members.

"Take him a little while to get back," remarked Trace, marching towards her friends by the door. "We should be okay to get rid of Ferguza before then."

"Right!" Cannon cracked her knuckles, which began to radiate a low shine as an eager smirk crept onto her face, "Sick of this magician crap- I'm gonna blow her brains out until she admits this is an act." Putting her skeptic nature aside, the tallest member of the team glanced down to nudge her brother with her boot.

Having stretched his torso under the door to unlock it, Putty gave a shudder at the poke (which was probably a giggle on the other side) and opened it a moment later for the two girls, shouting eagerly, "C'mon! She's just in here!"

"What kept you so lo-"

Before the twelve-year-old could get to nagging her brother, a loud, happy cry came from behind the three children, who turned around at once. The three other members of their costumed team (and the final, uncostumed "member") had just arrived, Jake and Songbird turning to brace the doors they''d just come in through.

"Here's a better question," noted Trace, turning around as the other members came nearer, specifically addressing her best friend, "What kept you so long?" Quickzip zoomed past her, immediately hugging both Cannon and Putty at once. "All you had to do was get through those cultists."

"Eensy bit more complicated than that, boss," replied Nimble with a snicker, holding his thumb and forefinger just a half-inch apart. "We're not the only super-bunch crashing the party. A gang came in with matching shirts and just started going to town on everybody."

Turning around to hug Trace as well, Quickzip added, "Mister Jake saw them coming when he was outside and got in here to warn us!"

"Didn't look like more sheep, didn't look like cops, so just assumed the worst. That's all." Still pressed against the door, Jake remarked to the little boy next to him, "Doesn't seem like they're trying to break in."

Songbird moved his ear to the door before pulling his weight off it. "No, sounds sorta like the cultists and Franklin are fighting them off. I don't know how long they'll last though, they seemed pretty synchronized."

"Hm." As the two blonds neared the rest of the group, Trace crossed her arms, "They say what they want?"

"They were demanding Ferguza for some reason," replied Songbird, floating between the Strine siblings. "A couple of them had some good powers going, but they really didn't do crap in presentation. They didn't even have real costumes, they just all wore the same shirt."

Nimble nodded, "It was less supervillain-team-out-for-vengeance and more soccer-team-who-haven't-learned-the-real-meaning-of-sportsmanship."

"Well, whatever," proclaimed Valerie with a dismissive wave, if they're still here once we're done with Ferguza, we can take them."

"Uh..." Reaching around Songbird to tug on his sister's burnt sleeve, Putty replied, "Yeah, about that..."

Following the youngest member's pointing finger, the group found Ferguza in the next room, surrounded by black-colored candles and chanting whilst holding her war wand. Her head was bowed and she didn't even seem to notice them.

"Hm." Holding up her hand to stop the rest of the group from advancing, Trace remarked, "Interesting... She seems totally vulnerable..."

Nudging their leader, Nimble asked, "How doya know it's not an act?"

"It explains why everyone was so preoccupied keeping us away from her." Glancing over her shoulder, Trace asked, "Jake, you're supposed to know about magic-"

"Supposedly magic," interrupted Valerie.

Regardless of whether the children believed in that act or not, Jake replied, albeit while rolling his eyes, "Look, I only know about magic from what I've seen in passing. But since you asked, she's obviously working on something big here."

"Ooo!" Nimble had played enough video games to know what that meant, "And we need to stop her before she finishes and kills us?

Jake's frown grew more pronounced, "That's-"

"Perfect." Cannon rose one arm and fired her blast, knocking into Ferguza and blowing her off her feet into the nearest wall. "Like shooting fish in a barrel."

"ARGH!" Now knocked out of her trance, Ferguza rose her head up dizzily, eyes focusing on the group in the doorway, "You? Oh, God, no..."

"Alright, Ferguza..." Marching into the room now, with the entire group behind her (even Jake at a distance), Trace demanded, "We'll give you a chance to leave our city and take your freak show with-"

"YOU IDIOTS!" Raising to her feet at once, the witch shrieked, "Do you have any idea what you just ruined?! I could have finally trapped that thing!"

"What-"

Beforethe group could say anything more, the circle they'd stepped into began to glow a dark, ominous purple, seemingly trapping them. The candles all blew out, leaving that the brightest source in the room.

"AH!" Looking about her so quickly her head was a blur, Quickzip shouted in terror, "Mister Jake? What's happening?!"

"RUN! Get out of this now! "

Grabbing Putty and Nimble by their necks just due to being the closest, the grown-up was prepared to drag the log of them out of the summoning circle. But as pain rushed over his temple, it was apparently too late.
154.title: Venusus

choices: The hallucinations continue as Jake decides to head to bed.
Jake decides to talk to a doctor about it.
Jake starts to wonder if this is connected to the encounter with Ferguza.
1542.content:
Early morning work in the bathrooms - that was always a lot of fun.

Yeah, 'fun' was certainly not the word, but even within his own head Jake was plenty sarcastic. With a sigh as he finished, he began to move to grip the ridge of his nose; he stopped himself, though, upon the realization that his hands had just been inside a toilet bowl cleaning it.

"Guess it beats doing this at a restaurant or something," the man growled under his voice as he walked toward the sink. At least the kids here were fairly clean in that respect, unlike the average public restroom that tended to come out looking like a buffet at the Human Centipede's house.

His voice filled the otherwise empty room again, louder this time, as he moaned, "God, my head hurts. Not that baldie'd let me have a day off for it. . ."

Well, at least could wash his hands and try for another few hours of sleep in case that cleared it up, he supposed.

As such he moved to turn the water on and then stuck his hands under, waiting for it to get warm.

Sssssssss. . .

It took a second for that sound to register as out of place, but it did right about the same time the water no longer felt like water. Instead it felt like something squirming all over the man's hands - and the sound was like that of a snake.

He quickly pulled his hands back, but all that looked to be coming out of the sink was water. And that led to a sigh as he mumbled, "I knew it, this job's driving me insane."

At that he put his hands under the water again, this time with the desired feeling and no particular sound to welcome it. But when he looked at the sink once more, he saw it looked to be black - and the otherwise blue-tiled walls appeared to be a bright yellow.
"Gah!" Jake's head shot up then, eyes widening a bit - and moreso when he saw that his own reflection appeared to have dark blue skin and hair, with the whites of his eyes a solid black.

Only for a moment, though - when he blinked in confusion, everything went back to the way it was supposed to be.
1542.title: Jake and the Snake

choices: Lore goes to teach, and finds that Jake is a student.
Lore goes to teach.... but it winds up being a subject that makes no sense.
Just a hallucination - a second later things return to as they were.
1543.content:
There was a drawn out sigh that carried with it the scent of tobacco as Lore walked past the front office. It was obvious even without the location and the smell who it was, but neither did much to help.

"You know. . ."

The girl in pink turned her head over and up to see Stickset with her arms crossed, an annoyed frown on her face as she continued, "For all of the vanishing you pull around here, I still see you entirely too much."

"Yeah, going looking for a fight with someone who dared walk past you does a lot to make you look good at your job."

"Come on, not a soul here believes you to be anything but a nuisance. Other than those moronic kids anyway, but what do their opinions count? They're just children anyway."

"Hmph."

Lore put a hand to her throbbing head, then groaned as she closed her eyes and answered, "Knock it off, I've got a headache."

"Like I'm going to let you get off just because your head hurts."

"Would be nice if you did. . ."

"Not what I'm paying you for."

Wait, what was that? Eyes opening and head turning to face the woman, Lore instantly realized something else -she was at eye-level with her now.

"Just because that little lab experiment made you able to rip cars in half doesn't mean you're one of them, so stop acting like it." Stickset moved one arm from across her chest to her hip, as she then explained, "You've got a class to teach about now, don't you? So get going, and stop causing problems or I'll see if I can't get you moved to being a much-needed second janitor."
1543.title: Lore begins to suffer odd effects different fro...

choices: Erika arrives, much to her own general confusion.
Lore discovers more bizarre attributes about her friends.
15431.content:
".... Fine, whatever..."

Confused but not about to show that to the doctor, Lore turned and made her exit, letting Stickset awkwardly hobble away. As she walked, the girl examined herself; she was wearing a sophistocated business suit in the same colors as her Trace suit. Now more bewildered then ever, she began to make her way toward one of the classrooms.

"Okay... Okay..." Breathing slowly to herself, the woman spoke slowly, still feeling her adult body. This was alarming, but no big deal. Just think about how this happened. Last thing she remembered, they were fighting Ferguza. That was right, wasn't it? But what happende after that? How did they beat-

"Miss Lore?"

Lost in her thoughts, the super-strong woman asked with a simple "Hm?"

"Yeah, I wanna get taken off diaper duty this week."

..... What? Trace whipped her head aorund in confusion, only for it to get worse when she saw exactly who she was talkign to. Just beside her was Jake. A shorter, pre-pubescent Jake. There was simply no mistaking that jacket or grumpy expression.

Before the Jewish woman could recover from this particular twist, the little-boy-who-shouldn't-be-one noted, "I get that Swanson needs someone to do it for her, but I hoenstly don't think she even likes boys doing it. Wouldn't Jenny be better for it?"

"Well, I had it all of last week," noted Jenny, walking by. To Lore's even further surprise, there were a pair of yellow-furred bunny ears hanging from her scalp in the manner of her hopetails. She didn't seem the least bit bothered by it though, only waving at the girl adult with a cheery, "Hi, Miss Lore!"
15431.title: Teaching In This School Just Got Even Weirder

choices: A beating on Stun King commences.
Before the group makes their move, the vigilante offers them a bigger target.
Some time later, footage of the incident finds its way onto the local news.
155.content:
The truth of the average fight between two people in costumes who are without powers or any particular training is it looks more like a brawl broken out at a Halloween party than anything.

Of course, like any good brawl there are always onlookers, and this one was no different; if anything, the fact that it was simply two normal guys beating each other up probably helped since there was no worry about being caught up in the fight and potentially harmed.

As such, as Stun King got in one last punch that finally downed his foe, he thought nothing of the fact that there were four people surrounding him.

In response to the clapping being done by one tall man, larger and more muscular than he himself even, the vigilante issued a slightly out of breath, "It's no trouble."

"I certainly hope not."

His voice sounded odd; possibly was foreign? In addition to that man Stun King surrounded a short, average-looking white girl, a black one who was tall and slender like a model, and a lanky redheaded man. And they were all wearing identical black T-shirts with #1 on them.

"Well. . ." The vigilante turned to where his foe lay unconscious and began to walk over to him. Something about this was making him feel uneasy, but he tried to ignore that as he said, "I'd love to stay and chat, but I need to get this guy down to the station and have somebody book him."

Before he reached the crook, though, he was taken offguard when a fifth, black man literally appeared from nowhere in front of him, also in the same shirt.

"W-What is this?"

"We're truly sorry, mister. . ."

That was a woman speaking, and a turn of his head showed it was a sixth, blond one who wore a sad smile but had a strange sort of maniacal look to her.

"You're just a lamb to the slaughter. . ."

That voice didn't seem to come from any of the people surround him, but it was a man. A look to the left showed what looked like the shape of a man in the air before it materialized into a handsome-looking man with middle-length blond hair and a brown goatee

"And a lamb must be sacrificed to the new gods of this city."
155.title: The Chosen Ones

choices: Once they finish, the group heads to try and learn more.
Before they follow that lead, One finds another target.
The beating makes its way to the news sometime later.
1552.content:
The group as a whole each made one step closer to their foe, all of them looking as though they were ready to sprint right up to him and get to dishing out a beating.

Stun King, while clearly panicked, tried to keep his heartbeat and heavy breathing under control as he said, "W-Wait! Wait, I'm a nobody!"

It was the apparent leader, with the foreign accent, who asked, "And we're about to make you a lot more famous."

"Wait, hold on a minute! My point is. . ."

The man dropped off whenever the group made another step inward, but as he circled slowly trying to keep tabs on them all he picked back up, "My point is attacking me would do nothing! You want somebody who's a big target - and I know someone good for it."

"Really?" That was the bearded one with camoflauge abilities, who had a surprisingly deep voice himself. "Explain."

"Okay. Okay. . ."

It looked like the group of seven were willing to wait and let him speak. Stun King was sure to be quick about it, though, "A few months ago there was this woman."

Now it was the tiny one, the girl with the sad smile, who asked, "Yeah?"

"Her name was something like Fertula or something - I don't know, but it wouldn't be hard to look up, she showed up on TV and everything. She was a witch or something, made it snow and was out for some kind of random or something."

"Sounds promising. . ."

Noticeably, the foreign man (who seemed to be the leader) and the slender black woman both stepped away from the group then. The woman pulled something from her pocket that looked like a small camcorder. After that the leader questioned, "Shade, are we ready?"

"Rolling."

"Excellent. Boys and girls? Have fun."

"W-Wait!"

There was no wait.
1552.title: Bigger Target

choices: The kids go to see Jake and talk to him about the group.
The kids move to look into it.... but are cut off by Stickset.
15523.content:
"Our top story tonight, a foiled robbery at the First Bank of Stonewall took a disturbing turn when --"

"Wait, turn it up. . ."

While there were probably a few complaints any time the channel on the TV when to the evening news from plenty of the kids in the center, there was also always at least some representation of a particular group of six arguing in favor of it. In this case it was the two blonds, and Grant was the one who gave the request while Jenny fulfilled it.

"As a precaution, this footage may be graphic."

The picture cut away from the anchorman then, to a shaky camera right in the face of a light-skinned black woman. Despite the amateur angles, however, the picture was of high quality and it seemed like things may have been edited in post as she said in a tone that seemed amused and smarmy yet bitter, "Testing, testing. . . One."

The camera was pulled back from the woman's face then, as she explained, "There is no two, there is no ten; there is only One. I am One, and they are One."

The camera was pointed to a group of six, where they seemed to have a seventh person at their mercy in a flurry of offense. "This is only our warning - that man, Stun King, is our sacrifice."

"Exactly."

That was a different person speaking, a man; the camera focused on him with a lot more stability and professionalism suddenly present, as he set to speaking with a fairly thick, "I am but the mouthpiece of our new order."

While this had the two blonds on the edge of their seat and their friends had come to watch in the interrim, Andy saw fit to pipe up, "Funny you can't understand a word the guy talking for them says, huh?"

"Quiet!"

Conveniently, the leader of one group had given enough of a pause to not say further until the leader of the other had asked for silence, "Anthony Wykcoff. Link Johnston. Susan Shade. Dylan Roberts. Jackie Harris. Nick Ledger. Alicia Clinton. Stacy Harding. It does not matter that you know who each is, it only matters that you know who we all are. We will be in touch."
15523.title: The beating makes its way to the news sometime ...
